revision.text:
{{italic title}} '''''(I Am) Nobody's Lunch''''' is a 2006 play with music produced by [[The Civilians]], an investigative theater company in New York City. Based on interviews conducted in 2003, the play explores the compromised issues of trust and truth that arose between the American government and its people during the lead-up to the Iraq War. ''(I Am) Nobody's Lunch'' was written and directed by Steve Cosson from interviews by the company, with music and lyrics by [[Michael Friedman (composer)|Michael Friedman]].Cosson, Steve. ''(I am) Nobody's Lunch/Gone Missing''. Oberon Books, 2007. ==Conception== ''(I Am) Nobody's Lunch'' grew from interviews with people from all over America about what they believe regarding their current government and public culture. When writing about the motivation to create such a work, writer and director Steve Cosson said
"If a democracy depends in part on there being some common understanding of what is actually taking place in the world, then we wanted to know if in fact if such a consensus existed, and if not, then just how are people parsing reality?"Cosson, Steve. "(I Am) Nobody's Lunch." ''The Civilians: An Anthology of Six Plays''. New York: Playscripts, Inc., 2008.
==Process== ''(I Am) Nobody's Lunch'' is marked by [[The Civilians]]' characteristic journalistic approach to theater, in which the play's foundation is built from a series of individual interviews, usually conducted by the cast members themselves. These interviews are not recorded, and transcribed later from memory. The dialogue from the interviews is then woven verbatim into the script, producing a kind of theater that Brian Logan from The Guardian describes thus: "[[The Civilians]] co-mingle docudrama with cabaret, spinning their interviewees' responses into improbable, inquisitive song-and-soliloquy revues."Logan, Brian. "True Lies." The Guardian (Thursday, August 10, 2006). ==The Play== ''(I Am) Nobody's Lunch'' takes on the question that was on the minds of many Americans as the Bush Administration began to launch the Iraq War: Who, or what, do we believe? It presents a dynamic range of real-life perspectives from across the country, from an Arab-American cab driver to a staffer at the Department of Homeland Security, everyone in the phone book listed under the name Jessica Lynch, an elderly Jewish woman, and even an alien. According to Sam Marlowe, in his review of ''(I Am) Nobody's Lunch'' when it played at the SoHo Theater in London, the play "considers the impossibility of certainty in a world stuffed with lies." Marlowe, Sam. "The Trouble With Asian Men/(I am) Nobody's Lunch." The Times (Monday, September 11, 2006). The scenes and monologues from Cosson's script are interspersed with composer [[Michael Friedman (composer)|Michael Friedman]]'s musical numbers, producing a cabaret-like piece of theatre.Byrne, Terry. "Satire with a Side of Ham in 'Lunch'." The Boston Herald (Friday, April 28, 2006) ==Production history== An early version of the play opened in September 2004 and was produced by [[The Civilians]] and presented by Performance Space 122. ''(I Am) Nobody's Lunch'' had its official U.S. Premiere by The Civilians at 59E59 Theaters, New York City, January 19, 2006.Zinoman, Jason. "They Feel a Homeland Security Song Coming On." The New York Times (January 29, 2006). The play then received its London Premiere by The Civilians at Soho Theatre on September 6, 2006, after playing an award-winning run at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival earlier that year.Quirke, Kieron. "Critic's Choice: Top Five Plays." The Evening Standard (September 15, 2006). ''(I Am) Nobody's Lunch'' also toured along the East Coast during April 2006, playing shows at the Annenberg Center for the Performing Arts in Philadelphia, PA (April 19 – 23, 2006) and the American Repertory Theater in Cambridge, MA (April 25 – 30, 2006).Kennedy, Louise. "Theater troupe gets creative with the facts: For Civilians, interviews are just the start." The Boston Globe (April 23, 2006). ==Public response and recognition== ''(I Am) Nobody's Lunch'' garnered favorable reviews from such publications as ''[[The New York Times]]'',Isherwood, Charles. "A Funny and Sad Look at Facts, Myths and Spin." The New York Times (January 23, 2006). ''[[The Boston Globe]]'',Siegel, Ed. "Turning the sad truth into spirited satire." The Boston Globe (April 27, 2006). and ''[[The Times]]''.Scott, Robert Dawson. "(I am) Nobody's Lunch." The Times (August 18, 2006). The play also won a coveted First Fringe award at the [[Edinburgh Fringe Festival]] in 2006 Eaton, Andrew."Equals among firsts." The Scotsman (December 23, 2009). and was named as a Critic's Choice: Top Five Plays selection by The Evening Standard.Quirke, Kieron. "Critic's Choice: Top Five Plays." The Evening Standard (September 15, 2006) ==Cast== U.S. Premiere: Quincy Tyler Bernstine, Matt Dellapina, Brad Heberlee, Daoud Heidami, Caitlin Miller, Jennifer R. Morris, and Andy Boronson. London Premiere: Matt Dellapina, Daoud Heidami, Brandon Miller, Caitlin Miller, Lexy Fridell, and Andy Boroson on piano. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:I Am}} [[Category:2006 plays]] [[Category:American plays]] [[Category:Plays set in the United States]] [[Category:Plays based on actual events]]

revision.text:
[[File:Shanghai people watch Expo opening ceremony on big TV 30apr10 300.jpg|thumb|250px|Citizens watching the ceremony from [[Nanjing Road (Shanghai)|Nanjing road]]]] The '''2010 Shanghai Expo opening ceremony''' (中国2010年上海世界博览会开幕式) occurred on April 30, 2010 at the [[Shanghai Arena|Shanghai World Expo Cultural Center]] in [[Shanghai]], [[People's Republic of China]], a day before the opening of the [[Expo 2010]].The opening ceremony was planned and designed by [[ECA2]]`s founder,Yves Pepin.
==Pre-ceremony== [[File:Expo 2010 Shanghai flags and China Pavilion.jpg|thumb|250px|All nation flags raised]] On April 29, 2010 [[Hu Jintao]] of the [[Communist Party of China]] sat down with [[Lien Chan]] of the [[Kuomintang]] in a pre-expo meeting.<ref>Chinareviewnews.com. "[http://www.chinareviewnews.com/doc/1013/0/6/1/101306124.html?coluid=1&kindid=0&docid=101306124&mdate=0430005716 Chinareviewnews.com]." ''台灣重返世博 是兩岸重要成果.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-17.</ref>
In the morning of April 30, the flags of 189 nations, 57 international organizations, the World expo bureau flag and the Shanghai expo flag were all raised at the expo venues.<ref name="xinh">Xinhuanet.com. "[http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/china/2010-04/30/c_13274164_2.htm Xinhuanet.com]." ''Art performances start at Expo opening ceremony in Shanghai.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-16.</ref><ref>Xinhuanet.com. "[http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/china/2010-04/30/c_13273714.htm Xinhuanet.com]." ''Official flags of participants hoisted in Shanghai Expo venue.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-16.</ref>
==Outdoor opening fireworks== The event began at 8:10 pm with a massive river side display of [[fireworks]] and [[Laser lighting display|lights]].<ref name="Chi1">Chinadaily.com. "[http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2010expo/2010-04/30/content_9799258.htm Chinadaily.com]." ''Hu declares open Shanghai World Expo.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-16.</ref>
==Indoor ceremony==
===Leader entrances=== Chinese president [[Hu Jintao]] enters Expo Culture center with many world leaders. Twenty foreign [[head of state|heads of state]] or government attended the opening ceremony:<ref name="xinhua 13272533">[http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/china/2010-04/29/c_13272533.htm 20 state or gov't heads to attend Shanghai World Expo opening ceremony] [[Xinhua]]</ref> *{{flag|Armenia}}n [[President of Armenia|President]] [[Serzh Sarkisyan]] *{{flag|Cambodia}}n [[Prime Minister of Cambodia|Prime Minister]] [[Hun Sen]] *{{flag|Republic of the Congo}} [[President of the Republic of Congo|President]] [[Denis Sassou-Nguesso]] *{{flagicon|Europe}} [[European Commission]] [[President of the European Commission|President]] [[José Manuel Barroso]] *{{flag|France|name=French}} [[President of France|President]] [[Nicolas Sarkozy]] and his wife [[Carla Bruni]] *{{flag|Gabon}}ese [[President of Gabon|President]] [[Ali Bongo Ondimba]] *{{flag|Kazakhstan|name=Kazakh}} [[Prime Minister of Kazakhstan|Prime Minister]] [[Karim Masimov]] *{{flag|Kenya}}n [[President of Kenya|President]] [[Mwai Kibaki]] *{{flagicon|PRK}} [[Kim Yong Nam]], [[List of heads of state of North Korea|President]] of the [[Supreme People's Assembly (Democratic People's Republic of Korea)#Presidium|Presidium]] of the [[Supreme People's Assembly (Democratic People's Republic of Korea)|Supreme People's Assembly]] of the [[Democratic People's Republic of Korea]] *{{flag|South Korea}}n [[President of the Republic of Korea|President]] [[Lee Myung-bak]] *{{flag|Malawi|1964}}an [[President of Malawi|President]] [[Bingu wa Mutharika]] *{{flag|Mali}}an [[President of Mali|President]] [[Amadou Toumani Touré]] *{{flag|Malta|name=Maltese}} [[President of Malta|President]] [[George Abela]] *{{flag|FSM|name=Micronesian}} [[President of Micronesia|President]] [[Emanuel Mori]] *{{flag|Mongolia}}n [[President of Mongolia|President]] [[Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj]] *{{flag|Netherlands|name=Dutch}} [[Prime Minister of the Netherlands|Prime Minister]] [[Jan Peter Balkenende]] *{{flag|Palestinian Authority|name=Palestinian}} [[President of the Palestinian Authority|President]] [[Mahmoud Abbas]] *{{flag|Seychelles}} [[President of Seychelles|President]] [[James Alix Michel]] *{{flag|Turkmenistan|name=Turkmen}} [[President of Turkmenistan|President]] [[Gurbanguly Berdymukhamedov]] *{{flag|Vietnam}}ese [[Prime Minister of Vietnam|Prime Minister]] [[Nguyen Tan Dung]]
In addition, speakers of legislative bodies, deputy heads, and ministers of over 20 other countries also attended the opening ceremony.<ref>[http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/china/2010-04/29/c_13272936.htm Foreign guests to attend opening ceremony of Shanghai World Expo] [[Xinhua]]</ref> Just a few hours before the opening ceremony, the Maltese President, [[George Abela]] suffered from an accident, which left his second [[Lumbar vertebrae]] slightly damaged. He was taken to the [[Ruijin Hospital]] in Shanghai, and therefore couldn't attend the ceremony. Chinese President [[Hu Jintao]] paid him a visit at the hospital the following day.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20100430/local/president-george-abela-injured-in-china|title=President George Abela injured in China|agency=The Times of Malta}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20100501/local/president-abela-visited-by-chinese-counterpart|title=President Abela visited by Chinese Counterpart|agency=The Times of Malta}}</ref> [[Hong Kong]] and [[Macau]] [[Special administrative region of the People's Republic of China|Special administrative region]] chief exec [[Donald Tsang]] and [[Fernando Chui]] both attended with a group of delegates.<ref>Hkexpo2010.gov.hk. "[http://www.hkexpo2010.gov.hk/eng/whats/news_detail_67.html Hkexpo2010.gov.hk]." ''HKSARG delegation to attend Shanghai Expo opening ceremony.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-16.</ref><ref>Macaudailytimes.com. "[http://www.macaudailytimes.com.mo/macau/11799-Jintao-praises-Macau-Hong-Kong-Pavilions.html Macaudailytimes.com]." ''Hu Jintao praises Macau, Hong Kong Pavilions.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-16.</ref>
===Presentations=== The song "Harmonious Gathering" (和谐欢歌) was performed by [[Hong Kong]]'s [[Jackie Chan]] and [[People's Republic of China|PRC]]'s [[Song Zuying]].<ref name="xinh" /> The [[Flag of the People's Republic of China|PRC flag]] was raised, and the [[March of the Volunteers]] was played. Then the international bureau exposition flag was raised, and the expo song was played. This was followed by the raising of the Shanghai Expo flag and the playing of the Shanghai Expo song. Then the flag-bearers of 246 participating countries and international organizations paraded out.<ref name="Chi1" /> [[Wang Qishan]], [[Vice Premier of the People's Republic of China]] and [[Bureau of International Expositions|BIE]] president Jean-Pierre Lafon both gave a speech.<ref name="Chi1" /><ref>Chinadaily.com.cn. "[http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2010expo/2010-04/30/content_9799319.htm Chinadaily.com.cn]." ''Vice premier: Expo to usher in new ways of life.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-16.</ref> Hu Jintao then opened up the expo performances with an official statement.
==Performances== The first song (相约上海) was sung by PRC's [[Mao Amin]], Lau Yuan-yuan (刘媛媛) and [[Taiwan]]'s [[Wakin Chau]]. They were also accompanied by dancers.<ref>Xinhuanet.com. "[http://news.xinhuanet.com/world/2010-04/30/c_1267114.htm Xinhuanet.com]." ''2010年上海世博會開幕式熱詞：《相約上海》.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-16.</ref> There were a total of 2,300 performers.<ref name="dm">Dailymail.co.uk. "[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/worldnews/article-1270102/China-celebrates-start-Shanghai-World-Expo-2010-incredible-opening-ceremony.html Dailymail.co.uk]." ''China celebrates the start of Shanghai World Expo 2010 with incredible opening ceremony.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-16.</ref> An [[orchestra]] featuring PRC [[pianist]] [[Lang Lang]] played "[[Mo Li Hua|Jasmine Flower]]", "[[The Blue Danube]]", "New Shanghai concerto" (新上海协奏曲), and "[[Yangtze river]] song" (长江之歌).
The theme song "Better city, Better life" was followed and sung by [[United States]]'s [[Jon B.|Jonathan Buck]] and [[Siedah Garrett]].<ref>Chinadaily.com. "[http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2010expo/2010-04/30/content_9799421.htm Chinadaily.com]." ''Expo theme song combines exotic, local flavors.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-16.</ref> An instrumental performance of "Brave Bugle" (勇敢的号角) is performed by a [[New Zealand]] troupe (纽西兰毛利艺术团).<ref>iFeng.com. "[http://big5.ifeng.com/gate/big5/expo2010.ifeng.com/dongtai/detail_2010_04/30/1476959_0.shtml iFeng.com] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20120708075718/http://big5.ifeng.com/gate/big5/expo2010.ifeng.com/dongtai/detail_2010_04/30/1476959_0.shtml |date=2012-07-08 }}." ''世博會開幕式文藝表演側記：跨越百年的世紀約會.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-16.</ref> [[Japan]]'s [[Shinji Tanimura]] then perform the song "star" (星). Afterwards the song "A type of love" (一种爱) was performed by the [[South Africa]]'s [[Soweto Gospel Choir]].<ref>Chinadaily.com. "[http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2010expo/2010-05/01/content_9799561.htm Chinadaily.com]." ''Shanghai Expo opens for the world.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-17.</ref> [[Italy]]'s [[Andrea Bocelli]] then followed up with a performance of "[[Nessun dorma]]".
The expo theme song (致世博) was performed by PRC's Huang Ying (黄英), Liao Chang (廖昌永), [[Tan Jing]] and [[Sun Nan]].<ref>Big5.enorth.com.cn. "[news.big5.enorth.com.cn/system/2010/04/30/004651068.shtml Big5.enorth.com.cn]." ''黃英廖昌永譚晶孫楠演唱世博會中文主題曲《致世博》--北方網-新聞中心.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-17.</ref> Two [[Tibetan people|Tibetan]] orphans who survived the earlier [[2010 Yushu earthquake]] joins the stage.<ref>Globaltimes.cn. "[http://china.globaltimes.cn/society/2010-05/527899.html Globaltimes.cn] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110707031718/http://china.globaltimes.cn/society/2010-05/527899.html |date=2011-07-07 }}." ''Tibetan orphans from quake zone show up at Shanghai World Expo opening ceremony .'' Retrieved on 2010-05-17.</ref>
==Outdoor performances==
===Fireworks===
[[File:2010ExpoFireworks.ogv|thumb|right|Fireworks climax viewed from under [[Nanpu Bridge]] towards the SW]]
[[File:Flickr - Swedish Pavilion at Shanghai Expo 2010 - (1).jpg|thumb|220px|Opening ceremony]] The 30-minute outdoor ceremony took place along a 3.4-km stretch of the [[Huangpu River]] in central Shanghai. It set numerous [[world record]]s, such as the biggest [[LED]] screen, the largest searchlight installation and one of the largest [[pyrotechnic]] displays ever created. The outdoor portion was produced by [[David Atkins]] enterprise.<ref name="Aspr">Asiaprnews.com. "[http://asiaprnews.com/2010/04/30/39345 Asiaprnews.com]." ''David Atkins Enterprises Delivers the Outdoor Opening Ceremony….'' Retrieved on 2010-05-16.</ref>
===Part 1=== First music piece was "China welcomes you" (中国欢迎你) accompanied by [[Spring Festival Overture]]. First music of that piece was "Civilization" (文明之光), followed by "Better City, Better Life" (城市，让生活更美好), followed by "Urban Rhapsody" (都市协奏曲). In this part was included the track "The Dragon" composed by [[Vangelis]] in his conceptual album [[China]]
===Part 2=== Second piece was "Happy at expo" (欢聚在世博) accompanied by [[Waltz]] [[The Blue Danube]], [[Violin concerto]], [[Butterfly Lovers' Violin Concerto]]. First music of that piece was "One World, One Home" (同一世界，同一家园), followed by "Water of Life" (生命之水).
===Part 3=== Third piece was "World celebrate together"(世界同欢庆) accompanied by the piece (在快速机器上的短暂骑行), "Oh, destiny goddess" (哦！命运女神), [[Ode to Joy]] (欢乐颂), "Night of fire festival" (火把节之夜), "Good beijing news to mountain village" (北京喜讯到山寨), [[Mo Li Hua|White jasmine]] (茉莉花).
==Concerts== In a separate concert [[Song Zuying]] performed with [[Taiwan]]'s [[Jay Chou]] in a celebration of the opening ceremony.<ref>Shanghai.cultural-china.com. "[http://shanghai.cultural-china.com/html/City-Beats/City-Feature/201005/03-5621.html Shanghai.cultural-china.com] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100509231258/http://shanghai.cultural-china.com/html/City-Beats/City-Feature/201005/03-5621.html |date=2010-05-09 }}." ''Lights Up Shanghai - The Grand Expo 2010 Opening Ceremony.'' Retrieved on 2010-05-17.</ref>
==See also== {{Commons category|Shanghai Expo opening ceremony}} * [[List of participants at the Expo Shanghai 2010]] * [[2008 Summer Olympics opening ceremony]] * [[2008 Summer Paralympics opening ceremony]] * [[2009 East Asian Games opening ceremony]]
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nrBYwIntpLo&feature=related Youtube 1 of 10 CCTV broadcast] {{Expo 2010}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:2010 Shanghai Expo Opening Ceremony}} [[Category:Expo 2010]] [[Category:Opening ceremonies]] [[Category:Ceremonies in China]] [[Category:Articles containing video clips]]

{{L2L|date=January 2017}} {{update|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox event | title = 2016 United States ''Elizabethkingia anophelis'' outbreak | image = File:Wisconsin in United States.svg | image_size = | image_alt = | caption = Wisconsin, in red, the location of 63 confirmed cases as of June 16, 2016 | native_name = | native_name_lang = | english_name = | time = | duration = | date = {{start date|2015|11|01}} — present | venue = | location = [[Wisconsin]], western [[Michigan]], and [[Illinois]], United States<ref name="sarahkaplan"/><ref name="illinois outbreak"/> | coordinates = <!-- {{coord|LAT|LON|region:XXXX_type:event|display=inline,title}} --> | also_known_as = | type = Disease outbreak | theme = | cause = ''[[Elizabethkingia anophelis]]'' | first_reporter = | budget = | patron = <!-- or |patrons= --> | organisers = <!-- or |organizers= --> | filmed_by = | participants = | outcome = | casualties1 = <!-- Change to WHO reference when available --> {{plainlist| * '''Cases / Deaths''' <small>(as of June 16, 2016)</small><ref name="cdc outbreak">{{cite web|title=Multistate Outbreak of Infections Caused by ''Elizabethkingia anophelis''|url=https://www.cdc.gov/elizabethkingia/outbreaks/index.html|website=Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)|accessdate=June 19, 2016|date=June 16, 2016}}</ref><ref name="illinois outbreak"/> * Wisconsin: 63 / 18 * Michigan: 1 / 1 * Illinois: 1 / 1}} | casualties2 = | casualties3 = | reported deaths = 20<ref name="cdc outbreak" /> | reported injuries = | reported missing = | reported property damage = | burial = | inquiries = | inquest = | coroner = | arrests = | suspects = | accused = | convicted = | charges = | trial = | verdict = | convictions = | sentence = | publication_bans = | litigation = | awards = | url = | blank_label = <!-- or |blank_data= --> | blank1_label = <!-- or |blank1_data= --> | blank2_label = <!-- or |blank2_data= --> | website = <!-- {{URL|example.com}} --> | notes = }}<!-- Per MOS:BOLDTITLE and WP:SBE, neither the article's title nor related text appears in bold. -->
An outbreak of ''[[Elizabethkingia anophelis]]'' infections centered in Wisconsin <ref name="WDHS1">Wisconsin Department of Health Services: "[https://www.dhs.wisconsin.gov/disease/elizabethkingia.htm Wisconsin 2016 ''Elizabethkingia anophelis'' outbreak]", last revised: March 30, 2016.</ref><ref name="Perrinetal">{{cite journal |vauthors=Perrin A, Larsonneur E, Nicholson AC, Edwards DJ, Gundlach KM, Whitney AM, Gulvik CA, Bell ME, Rendueles O, Cury J, Hugon P, Clermont D, Enouf V, Loparev V, Juieng P, Monson T, Warshauer D, Elbadawi LI, Walters MS, Crist MB, Noble-Wang J, Borlaug G, Rocha EP, Criscuolo A, Touchon M, Davis JP, Holt KE, McQuiston JR, Brisse S |title=Evolutionary dynamics and genomic features of the ''Elizabethkingia anophelis'' 2015 to 2016 Wisconsin outbreak strain |journal=Nat Commun |year=2017 |pmid=28537263 |doi=10.1038/ncomms15483 |volume=8 |pmc=5458099 |page=15483}}</ref> is thought to have led to the death of at least 20 people in Wisconsin, Michigan, and Illinois.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/a-mysterious-infection-may-have-killed-18-people-in-wisconsin-and-health-officials-aren%e2%80%99t-sure-why/ar-AAgC3fq |title=A mysterious infection may have killed 18 people in Wisconsin, and health officials aren’t sure why |website=Msn.com |date= |accessdate=March 11, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Health/rare-elizabethkingia-bacteria-outbreak-infects-44-wisconsin-killing/story?id=37399793 |title=Rare Elizabethkingia Bacteria Outbreak Infects 44 in Wisconsin, Killing 18 – ABC News |website=Abcnews.go.com |date=March 4, 2016 |accessdate=March 11, 2016}}</ref><ref name="sarahkaplan">{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2016/03/18/the-mysterious-infection-that-might-be-behind-17-deaths-in-wisconsin-has-spread-to-a-second-state/|title=The mysterious infection that might be behind 17 deaths in Wisconsin has spread to a second state|author=Sarah Kaplan|date=18 March 2016|work=Washington Post}}</ref><ref name="illinois outbreak">{{cite web|last1=Gallardo|first1=Michelle|title=Illinois Death Linked to Elizabethkingia Outbreak That Killed 18|url=http://abc7chicago.com/health/illinois-death-linked-to-elizabethkingia-outbreak-that-killed-18/1287763/|website=ABC 7 Eyewitness News|publisher=WLS-TV|accessdate=April 14, 2016}}</ref> As of March 2016 it was reported to be the largest [[Outbreak of infection|outbreak]] of ''[[Elizabethkingia anophelis]]''-caused disease [[research|investigated]] by the [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]] (CDC).<ref>{{cite news|last=Ehlke |first=Gretchen |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/health-science/source-of-bloodstream-infection-in-wisconsin-unknown/2016/03/09/e1235934-e60e-11e5-a9ce-681055c7a05f_story.html |title=Source of bloodstream infection in Wisconsin unknown |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |date= |accessdate=March 11, 2016}}</ref>
Human infections by ''Elizabethkingia anophelis'' involve the bloodstream.<ref name="WDHS1"/> Signs and symptoms can include fever, shortness of breath, chills, and [[cellulitis]].<ref name="WDHS1"/> Confirmation requires a laboratory test.<ref name="WDHS1"/>
Statewide surveillance of the situation in Wisconsin was organized on January 5, 2016.<ref name="WISN12">WISN 12 News: "[http://www.wisn.com/health/dhs-investigates-bacterial-blood-infection-outbreak/38309806 Cases of blood infection reported in Southeast Wisconsin | 44 cases of ''Elizabethkingia anophelis'' reported since Nov. 1]", March 3, 2016.</ref> Cases had been reported from [[Columbia County, Wisconsin|Columbia]], [[Dane County, Wisconsin|Dane]], [[Dodge County, Wisconsin|Dodge]], [[Fond du Lac County, Wisconsin|Fond du Lac]], [[Jefferson County, Wisconsin|Jefferson]], [[Milwaukee County, Wisconsin|Milwaukee]], [[Ozaukee County, Wisconsin|Ozaukee]], [[Racine County, Wisconsin|Racine]], [[Sauk County, Wisconsin|Sauk]], [[Sheboygan County, Wisconsin|Sheboygan]], [[Washington County, Wisconsin|Washington]], [[Waukesha County, Wisconsin|Waukesha]], and [[Winnebago County, Wisconsin|Winnebago]] counties); Illinois; and western [[Michigan]] as of April 13, 2016.<ref name="WISN12"/><ref name="sarahkaplan"/>
Between November 1, 2015 and March 30, 2016, 62 cases of ''[[Elizabethkingia anophelis]]'' infections were reported to the Wisconsin Department of Health Services (DHS), Division of Public Health (DPH).<ref name="WDHS1"/>
The severity of the outbreak is reflected in a statement by the CDC that "the agency sees a handful of ''Elizabethkingia'' infections around the country each year, but the outbreaks rarely involve more than a couple of cases at a time. To have dozens of cases at once — and more than a third of them possibly fatal — is startling".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pbs.org/newshour/bb/cdc-offers-new-call-arms-nightmare-bacteria/ |title=CDC offers new call to arms on nightmare bacteria |website=PBS NewsHour |date= |accessdate=March 11, 2016}}</ref> {{clear}}
== References == {{Reflist}} {{Elizabethkingia}} [[Category:Medical outbreaks in the United States]] [[Category:2016 health disasters]] [[Category:2016 disasters in the United States]] [[Category:2016 in Wisconsin]] [[Category:2010s medical outbreaks]]
{{disaster-stub}}

The '''2018 Washington Veterans Day Parade''' (colloquially called "Trump's military parade") was a planned military parade that would have taken place in [[Washington, D.C.]] on 10 November 2018 in honor of the [[Veterans Day]] holiday (which will take place on 11 November). On August 16, 2018, it was announced that the military parade would be postponed until 2019.<ref>{{cite news |last1=News |first1=ABC |title=Trump's military parade is postponed until 2019 |url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/trumps-military-parade-estimated-cost-92-million/story?id=57218363 |accessdate=17 August 2018 |work=ABC News |date=16 August 2018 |language=en}}</ref> In cancelling the parade for 2018, Trump cited the projected high costs for the parade and blamed Washington DC city officials for the high projected costs.<ref>{{cite news|url= https://www.nbcnews.com/news/amp/ncna901576|title=Trump cancels military parade, blames D.C. officials for high cost|date=August 17, 2018|publisher=[[NBC News]]|first=Dartunorro|last=Clark}}</ref>
== Background == The parade was expected to include members of all five armed services; the [[United States Army|Army]], [[United States Navy|Navy]], [[United States Air Force|Air Force]], [[United States Marine Corps|Marine Corps]] and the [[United States Coast Guard|Coast Guard]], with other units that were to be dressed in period uniforms representing earlier times in the United States military history.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2018/08/18/trump-military-parade-plans-unravel-over-costs.html|title=Trump military parade plans unravel over costs|date=2018-08-18|work=Fox News|access-date=2018-08-19|language=en-US}}</ref> A memo from [[Joseph Dunford|General Joseph Dunford]] reported that the parade was to have focused on historic battles and conflicts such as the [[American Revolutionary War|Revolutionary War]] and the [[War of 1812]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://abc7news.com/politics/trumps-military-parade-could-cost-$12-million-official/3783554/|title=Trump's military parade could cost $12 million: Official|date=2018-07-18|work=ABC7 San Francisco|access-date=2018-08-20|language=en-US}}</ref> Between 5,000 and 7,000 service members were to have taken part in the parade, which was to begin at the [[U.S. Capitol]] and end at the [[White House]]. The evolution of women in the service was also to be highlighted in the parade, along with an emphasis on the price of freedom.<ref name=":2">{{Cite news|url=https://www.ausa.org/news/details-emerging-dc-veterans-day-parade|title=Details Emerging on D.C. Veterans Day Parade|date=2018-03-12|work=Association of the United States Army|access-date=2018-08-20|language=en}}</ref> The parade would have included 100 wheeled vehicles instead of tanks, as well as a heavy air component featuring 50 aircraft at the end of the parade.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wtop.com/local/2018/03/trump-getting-washington-military-parade-_-but-no-tanks/amp/|title=Trump getting Washington military parade but no tanks - WTOP|website=wtop.com}}</ref><ref name="nola.com">{{cite web|url=https://articles.nola.com/national_politics/2018/07/trumps_military_parade_expecte.amp|title=Trump's military parade expected to have over 7,000 troops: report|publisher=}}</ref> U.S. President Donald Trump would have been situated in a reviewing area and surrounded by military heroes.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=https://www.npr.org/2018/08/16/639435987/no-veterans-day-military-parade-this-year-dod-looking-at-dates-in-2019|title=No Military Parade For Trump In D.C. This Year; Pentagon Looking At Dates In 2019|work=NPR.org|access-date=2018-08-19|language=en}}</ref> [[Medal of Honor]] recipients would have been included in reviewing the parade with the President and would have marched in the parade.<ref name=":2" />
The parade would also have coincided with the 100th anniversary of the end of [[World War I]].<ref name=":1" /> It was to have been the first full scale parade in the nation's capital since [[National Victory Celebration|1991]] involving the men and women of the active and reserve components of the [[United States Armed Forces]] and veterans' organizations and the first national Veterans' Day parade in years. U.S. President [[Donald Trump]] requested the military parade following his admiration of the [[Bastille Day military parade]] at the [[Champs-Élysées]] in [[Paris]] which he attended in 2017.
=== Cancellation of 2018 parade === On August 17, 2018 U.S. President [[Donald Trump]] stated he canceled the parade due to the "ridiculous" $92 million price tag.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2018/08/17/Trump-slams-92M-tab-for-canceled-Veterans-Day-parade-in-Washington/2111534512756/?rc_fifo=1|title=Trump slams D.C. officials for parade's 'ridiculous' $92M price tag|work=UPI|access-date=2018-08-17|language=en}}</ref> Through Twitter he blamed local politicians for the price and suggested hosting another parade in 2019, and ended his tweets with; "Maybe we will do something next year in D.C. when the cost comes WAY DOWN. Now we can buy some more jet fighters!"<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-45225102|title=Trump cancels military parade over costs|date=2018-08-17|work=BBC News|access-date=2018-08-17|language=en-GB}}</ref>
In spite of Trump's statements, Budget Director [[Mick Mulvaney]] claimed that the cancellation was not just for reasons of cost.<ref>{{cite news|title=Mulvaney on canceled military parade: It wasn’t just the money|url=https://www.politico.com/story/2018/08/19/mulvaney-trump-military-parade-788157|first= Rebecca |last =Morin|date=August 19, 2018|publisher=[[Politico]]}}</ref>
== Cost == A Pentagon official estimated the cost of the parade between $3 million and $50 million, earlier in 2018.<ref name="nola.com" /><ref>{{cite news|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/estimated-5000-7000-service-members-march-trumps-military/story?id=56715855|title=5,000 to 7,000 service members to march in Trump's military parade: Source|last=McLaughlin|first=Elizabeth|date=July 20, 2018|publisher=[[ABC News]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://thehill.com/policy/defense/398109-thousands-of-service-members-to-participate-in-trumps-military-parade-report|title=Thousands of service members to participate in Trump's military parade: report|last=Bowden|first=John|date=20 July 2018|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2018/03/09/592528659/trumps-military-parade-is-set-for-veterans-day|title=Trump's Military Parade Is Set For Veterans Day|publisher=}}</ref> Another suggestion of the cost was closer to $92 million, with at least $50 million being used to cover Pentagon costs for aircraft, equipment, personnel, and other support. This number was refuted by Defense Secretary [[Jim Mattis]] who stated; "I'm not dignifying that number ($92 million) with a reply."<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/best-states/washington-dc/articles/2018-08-16/official-says-trumps-military-parade-would-cost-about-92m|title=Pentagon Delays Trump's Military Parade Until at Least 2019|last=Baldor|first=Lolita|date=August 16, 2018|website=U.S. News|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=August 17, 2018}}</ref> The $92 million estimate was to be divided between the [[United States Department of Defense|Defense Department]] and the [[United States Department of Homeland Security|Department of Homeland Security]], which would have contributed $50 million and $42 million respectively.<ref name=":0" />
Separately DC City officials estimated expenses related to the parade would have been $21.6 million with an expectation for reimbursement from the Federal government, with the Mayor of Washington DC [[Muriel Bowser]] reporting that $13 million would have been used alone to cover police costs.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/the-latest-trump-blames-dc-for-military-parade-cancellation/2018/08/17/f3f8a6b0-a27a-11e8-a3dd-2a1991f075d5_story.html|title=The Latest: Trump blames DC for military parade cancellation|website=Washington Post|language=en|access-date=2018-08-20}}</ref>
== Opinion of parade ==
=== Support === In February 2017, few lawmakers backed the idea of a military parade. [[David Perdue|Senator David Perdue]] a Republican of [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]] told reporters "He's the President of the United States. Personally, I would prefer not to do it. But he's the president."<ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/07/us/politics/trump-military-parade-america.html|title=Trump Wants a Military Parade. But Not Everyone Is in Step.|last=Gibbons-Neff|first=Thomas|access-date=2018-08-24|language=en}}</ref> Senator [[Lindsey Graham]] a Republican of [[South Carolina]], supported the parade if it honored the military itself, and not the "...[[Soviet Union|Soviet]]-style hardware display."<ref name=":3" />
[[AMVETS]] an group that advocates for military veterans felt that potentially the parade would inspire more Americans to join the armed forces.<ref name=":4">{{Cite news|url=https://www.npr.org/2018/02/07/584059931/veterans-are-divided-on-response-to-trumps-desire-for-military-parade|title=Veterans Are Divided On Response To Trump's Desire For Military Parade|work=NPR.org|access-date=2018-08-24|language=en}}</ref>
=== Against === Other politicians spoke out against the parade. Representative [[Adam Smith (politician)|Adam Smith]] a Democrat of [[Washington (state)|Washington]] and members of the [[United States House Committee on Armed Services|House Armed Services Committee]] released a statement that highlighted "A military parade like this - one that is unduly focused on a single person - is what [[Authoritarianism|authoritarian regimes]] do, not democracies."<ref name=":3" /> Senator [[John Kennedy (Louisiana politician)|John Kennedy]] a Republican of [[Louisiana]] told reporters "We're not [[North Korea]], we're not [[Russia]], and we're not [[China]] and I don't want to be." while speaking out against the proposed parade.<ref name=":5">{{Cite news|url=http://www.sandiegouniontribune.com/opinion/the-conversation/sd-trump-military-parade-has-put-america-odds-20180208-htmlstory.html|title=What veterans in San Diego and elsewhere think of a Trump military parade|last=Gomez|first=Luis|work=sandiegouniontribune.com|access-date=2018-08-24|language=en-US}}</ref>
[[Robert J. O'Neill (U.S. Navy SEAL)|Robert O'Neill]] a former [[United States Navy SEALs|Navy SEAL]] tweeted in February 2018 that any military parade would be "...third world bullshit."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://twitter.com/mchooyah/status/961644132119859200?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw&ref_url=https://www.vox.com/world/2018/2/8/16991644/trump-military-parade-navy-seal-tweet|title=Robert J. O'Neill on Twitter|work=Twitter|access-date=2018-08-24|language=en}}</ref> Other military veterans echoed the sentiment with calls for the money to be spent on housing, employment and mental health care to better support the troops.<ref name=":5" /> A veteran of the [[War in Afghanistan]] highlighted that it would seem unreasonable to hold a parade in celebration while a 17 year-old war (per 2018) was still on going.<ref name=":4" />
==See also== *[[Veterans Day Parade (New York City)]] *[[Grand Review of the Armies]] *[[National Victory Celebration]] *[[New York at War]] *[[New York City Victory Parade of 1946]]

{{current wildfire}} {{Infobox wildfire | title = 416 Fire | image = 2018 06 01-20.31.59.916-CDT.jpg | caption = 416 Fire on June 1, 2018 | cost = $27,000,000 | injuries = | fatalities = | reference = <ref name="InciWeb">{{cite web|title=416 Fire|url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5822/|website=InciWeb|publisher=US Forest Service|access-date=4 June 2018}}</ref><ref name="IW7118">{{cite web |title=July 1, 2018- 416 Fire Update - InciWeb the Incident Information System |url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/article/5822/43571/ |website=InciWeb |access-date=1 July 2018 |language=en}}</ref> <ref name="InciWeb2">{{cite web|title=burro Fire|url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5834/|access-date=2 July 2018}}</ref>
<!-- ONLY FOR INDIVIDUAL FIRES --> | date = {{Start date|2018|6|1}} – {{End date}} | location = [[San Juan National Forest]], [[Colorado]], [[United States]] | coordinates = {{coord|37.461|-107.808|display=inline,title}} | pushpin_map = USA Colorado | pushpin_map_caption = Location of fire in Colorado. | area = {{Convert|55000|acre|ha|0}} | buildings = 0 | cause = Unknown | landuse = | perps = | motive = }} The '''416 & Burro Fire Complex''' are active wildfires in the southwestern portion of [[Colorado]] in the [[United States]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/|title=InciWeb the Incident Information System|last=helpdesk@dms.nwcg.gov|first=InciWeb developed and maintained by USDA Forest Service, Fire and Aviation Management,|website=inciweb.nwcg.gov|language=en|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref>. The fires are predominately within [[San Juan National Forest]], 13 miles north of [[Durango, Colorado|Durango]] and 14 miles south of [[Rico, Colorado|Rico]]. The 416 fire started on June 1, 2018 and the Burro Fire followed on June 8th. The causes are still under investigation<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5834/|title=Burro Fire Information — InciWeb the Incident Information System|last=helpdesk@dms.nwcg.gov|first=InciWeb developed and maintained by USDA Forest Service, Fire and Aviation Management,|website=inciweb.nwcg.gov|language=en|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5822/|title=416 Fire Information — InciWeb the Incident Information System|last=helpdesk@dms.nwcg.gov|first=InciWeb developed and maintained by USDA Forest Service, Fire and Aviation Management,|website=inciweb.nwcg.gov|language=en|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref>. As of July 2, 2018 the fires have burned a combined total of over {{Convert|55000|acre|ha|0}} and have cost more than $27 million to contain<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://kdvr.com/2018/06/30/416-fire-grows-costs-increase/|title=416 Fire grows to more than 51,000 acres, firefighting cost rises to $27 million|date=2018-07-01|work=FOX31 Denver|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":1" /><ref name=":0" />. It is one of the [[List of Colorado wildfires|largest wildfires in Colorado's history]] and has had major impacts on tourism and commerce for communities in the southwest portion of the state<ref name=":2">{{Cite news|url=https://durangoherald.com/articles/229583|title=State documenting financial losses from 416 Fire|work=Durango Herald|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en}}</ref><ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=https://durangoherald.com/articles/228339|title=Silverton cancels famed Fourth of July fireworks show|work=Durango Herald|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en}}</ref>.
==Events== ===June=== The 416 Fire started around 10:00 a.m. on June 1, 2018, approximately 10 miles north of [[Durango, Colorado]] and west of [[U.S. Route 550|Highway 550]]. By the morning of June 2, the fire had expanded into the [[San Juan National Forest]] and had burned an estimated {{Convert|1100|acre|ha|0}}. The highway was closed between milemarkers 34 and 48 for public safety and to allow firefighters to keep the fire from crossing the highway. County Road 250 was also closed. Evacuation orders were put in place for residents of Baker's Bridge at County Road 250 north to Electra Lake Road, where 825 structures are threatened.<ref name="InciWeb62am">{{cite web |title=416 Fire Update for June 2, 2018 — InciWeb the Incident Information System |url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/article/5822/43050/ |website=InciWeb |publisher=United States Forest Service |access-date=5 June 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
By the evening of June 3, the fire had grown to {{Convert|2255|acre|ha|0}} and was 10 percent contained. It expanded Hermosa Creek, prompting officials to issue pre-evacuation orders to the community of Hermosa.<ref name="InciWeb63pm">{{cite web |title=416 Fire Update June 3, 2018 pm — InciWeb the Incident Information System |url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/article/5822/43076/ |website=InciWeb |publisher=United States Forest Service |access-date=5 June 2018 |language=en}}</ref> The next day, the fire showed significant activity due to winds. Highway 550 was again closed due to heavy smoke and fire teams focused on building defensible spaces around buildings and using controlled burns as needed.<ref name="IW64PM">{{cite web |title=416 Fire Update for June 4, 2018 pm — InciWeb the Incident Information System |url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/article/5822/43080/ |website=InciWeb |publisher=United States Forest Service |access-date=5 June 2018 |language=en}}</ref> The fire is at 10 percent containment.<ref name="Miller">{{cite web |last1=Miller |first1=Blair |title=416 Fire burning in southwest Colorado remains 10% contained at 2,400 acres |url=https://www.thedenverchannel.com/news/wildfire/416-fire-burning-in-southwest-colorado-remains-10-contained-at-2-400-acres |website=7NEWS |access-date=5 June 2018 |date=5 June 2018}}</ref>
By June 5, new pre-evacuation orders were put in place for areas east of Hermosa due to southerly winds keeping the flames on the ridgeline on the slopes near the community. Temperatures were hotter than average and Forest Service personnel cited increased drought conditions as creating additional challenges.<ref name="InciWeb65PM">{{cite web |title=416 Fire Evening Update June 5, 2018 — InciWeb the Incident Information System |url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/article/5822/43102/ |website=InciWeb |publisher=United States Forest Service |access-date=6 June 2018 |language=en}}</ref> Crews continued to fight the fire using aerial support.<ref name="IW627">{{cite web |title=June 27, 2018- Evening 416 Fire Update — InciWeb the Incident Information System |url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/article/5822/43503/ |website=inciweb.nwcg.gov |access-date=29 June 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
The Burrow Fire began on the opposite side of the Hermosa Creek Wilderness Area on June 8th<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/article/5822/43503/|title=June 27, 2018- Evening 416 Fire Update — InciWeb the Incident Information System|last=helpdesk@dms.nwcg.gov|first=InciWeb developed and maintained by USDA Forest Service, Fire and Aviation Management,|website=inciweb.nwcg.gov|language=en|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref>. As of July 2, 2018 the fire had spread to within 10 miles of the 416 fire and burned over {{Convert|4000|acre|ha|0}}<ref name=":0" />.
By June 29, the 416 fire had expanded to {{Convert|41617|acre|ha|0}} and was 37 percent contained. The fire continued moving north, with crews clearing and chipping brush piles along the [[Durango and Silverton Narrow Gauge Railroad]]. Burnouts continued in the southwest in No Buck Creek.<ref name="IW628">{{cite web |title=June 29, 2018- 416 Fire Morning Update — InciWeb the Incident Information System |url=https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/article/5822/43524/ |website=inciweb.nwcg.gov |access-date=29 June 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
===July=== By July 1, the fire had grown to {{Convert|49301|acre|ha|0}} and was 37 percent contained. Temperatures enabled crews to focus on containment in the south and southwestern side of the fire, while northwest winds caused smokey conditions for communities along Highway 550, including [[Durango, Colorado|Durango]] and Hermosa Creek. Concerns about the fire impacting the [[Purgatory Resort]] were reduced, however hotshot crews remained in the area to protect the resort, if needed.<ref name="IW7118" />
== Impact == Over 1300 homes and businesses were forced to evacuate due to the fire<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.denverpost.com/2018/06/09/416-fire-wildfire-durango-june-9-weekend/|title=1,300 homes evacuated as 416 fire north of Durango grows|date=2018-06-09|work=The Denver Post|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en-US}}</ref>. As of July 2, no businesses or homes have been destroyed by the fire.
The fire forced the closure of [[Purgatory Resort|Purgatory Ski Resort]], [[Durango and Silverton Narrow Gauge Railroad|Durango and Silverton Narrow Gauge Railroad]], and the [[San Juan National Forest]], as well as sporadic closures of [[U.S. Route 550|Highway 550]]<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.firehouse.com/operations-training/wildland/news/21008878/san-juan-national-forest-closes-co-416-wildfire-grows|title=CO Blaze Shuts Down San Juan National Forest|work=Firehouse|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.durango.org/current-fire-information-and-updates/|title=Current Fire Information and Updates {{!}} Official Tourism Site of Durango, Colorado|website=www.durango.org|language=en|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://theknow.denverpost.com/2018/06/05/durango-and-silverton-narrow-gauge-railroad-2018-fire-cancelations/186507/|title=More Narrow Gauge Railroad rides canceled as fire burns near Durango|date=2018-06-05|work=The Know|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.codot.gov/news/2018/june/us-550-closed-north-of-durango-due-to-the-416-fire|title=US 550 Closed North of Durango Due to "The 416 Fire" —|website=www.codot.gov|language=en|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref>. The town of [[Silverton, Colorado|Silverton]] had to cancel their famed 4th of July Fireworks, which brings thousands of visitors to the tiny mountain town. Railroad tourism regained operation in July with diesel locomotives and steam engine services to Silverton resume on July 17th<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.durango.org/current-fire-information-and-updates/|title=Current Fire Information and Updates {{!}} Official Tourism Site of Durango, Colorado|website=www.durango.org|language=en|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref>. Purgatory resumed its summer operations on July 2nd<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.abqjournal.com/1191986/416-fire-purgatory-resort-to-reopen-durango-area-likely-safe.html|title=416 Fire: Purgatory resort to reopen, Durango area likely safe|last=(tns)|first=The Daily Times, Farmington, N.M.|website=www.abqjournal.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref>
The July 4th cancelations and highway, rail, and trail closures have devastated the tourism industry of Silverton, and has had a substantial impact on the economies of Durango and elsewhere in southwest Colorado<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.kob.com/new-mexico-news/416-fire-affecting-durango-silverton-economy/4942486/|title=416 Fire affecting Durango, Silverton economy|work=KOB 4|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en}}</ref>.
==Closures== Areas of [[San Juan National Forest]] are closed, specifically:<ref name="IW628" /> *All trails that tie into the Colorado Trail off of Highway 550 from the Molas Trailhead south to the Junction Creek Trailhead

{{Infobox artwork/wikidata |image = A Needle Woman PS1.jpg | caption = PS1 MoMA, exhibition view, 2001 |onlysourced=yes}} '''A Needle Woman''' is a performance video artwork created by artist [[Kimsooja]]. The videos projected simultaneously that comprise [[Kimsooja]]’s ''A Needle Woman'' (1999) presents the artist wearing precisely the same clothes, standing precisely the same way, and, it would seem, at the same time of day in various urban environments.<ref name=Madoff>Madoff, Steven Henry, “Gnomon of Place, Gnomon of foreignness.” Host & Guest catalogue for group exhibition at Tel Aviv Museum of Art, 2013</ref> == History == A Needle Woman premiered at CCA Kitakyushu in 1999. In the Kitakyshu version the artist presented a video channel where she lied on top of a rock formation, as Kimsooja explained “When I was invited to make a new commissioned work at the Center for Contemporary Art in Kitakyushu, Japan, I thought I would do a performance piece - one in the city of Tokyo, and the other one in nature. Then I would juxtapose them together. (…) As a result one was standing still in the middle of a crowd, while the other was lying down on a rock, facing nature. Verticality and horizontality were a metaphor for a dynamic balance between urban and natural forces.” <ref>Ingrid Commandeur, Kimsooja: Black holes, Meditative Vanishings and Nature as a Mirror of the Universe, in Windflower, Perceptions of Nature, NAI and Kroller-Muller Museum ,2012</ref>In further installations of ''A Needle Woman'' Kimsooja focused on the urban aspect of the work and shot a number of new videos where she stood absolutely still, her back facing the camera, amid passing crowds of inhabitants in Patan, Nepal; Havana, Cuba; N’Djamena, Chad; Rio de Janeiro, Brazil; Sana’a, Yemen; Jerusalem, Israel.<ref name=Madoff/>
Kimsooja in these videos is often described as a nomadic figure traveling across the world to come to rest in a crowded thoroughfare. The Needle referred to in the title is Kimsooja theorizing herself as a needle passing through the fabric of a place and its people. A common feature of the locations visited in the work is that they are all places of violence, disrepair or unresolved conflict; lending to the needle a metaphoric function as an instrument of suture and healing.<ref name=Madoff/> Subsequent versions of ''A Needle Woman'' were shown at [[MoMA PS1]] Contemporary art center in 2001, at the [[Kunsthalle Bern]] in Bern Switzerland in 2001, for the 51st [[Venice Biennale]] as part of the [[Arsenale]] in 2005, and was projected as a single channel public art project for La Nuit Blanche on the facade of [[Hôtel de Ville, Paris|Hotel de Ville]], Paris in 2009 <ref>Kimsooja Biography: http://www.kimsooja.com/biography.html</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Needle Woman}} [[Category:Performances]] [[Category:Contemporary works of art]] [[Category:Korean art]] [[Category:Video art]] [[Category:1999 works]]

'''Art cycling in Millstatt''' (German: "KUNSTradln in Millstatt") is an international [[art exhibition]] in [[Millstatt]] am See ([[Carinthia]]/[[Austria]]). It takes the form of various art stations throughout Millstatt connected by a cycle route.
== Concept and organization == The exhibition debuts 2018 from May 11 to October 28, and will be repeated in the following years. It has 25 stops at various locations in the community of Millstatt. These art stations form a loop through Millstatt, which can be visited by art-interested visitors, either walking or cycling the trail (hence the name "Art cycling in Millstatt"). Works by approximately 65 internationally known artists from [[Austria]], [[Germany]], [[United States]], [[Switzerland]], [[Croatia]], [[Poland]], [[Greece]], [[South Korea]] and [[Guatemala]] are connected in the exhibition.
For the first time, this exhibition concept also combines the various existing art and cultural institutions in Millstatt in a joint program. In addition, the concept opens up a number of new and sometimes unusual places in Millstatt as a presentation opportunity for [[modern art]].<ref>[https://www.kleinezeitung.at/kultur/5444177/Kunstradln-in-Millstatt_Fuer-die-Kunst-in-die-Pedale-treten Newspaper article in the Austrian statewide journal "Kleine Zeitung" (in German)], accessed July 1, 2018.</ref>
The access to modern art at [[art museum]]s, [[art exhibition]]s and [[Art gallery|art galleries]] is often characterized by the fact that only an art-interested and art-oriented [[audience]] is able or wanting to participate.<ref>see Bresler, Liora (ed.): International Handbook of Research in Arts Education, Dordrecht 2007; Springer, {{ISBN|9781402029981}}, vol. 2, pp. 941ff.</ref> The project "Art cycling in Millstatt" provides a low-threshold mediating of art as follows: #by giving access over a long period (6 months) #by using Millstatt as a whole as [[Arts centre|art space]] for residents and guests alike #by inviting a non-predefined art audience to participate, including randomly passing people (and cyclists too), who can and may come into contact with art in this way.<ref>[https://www.ktn.gv.at/Service/News?nid=28432 Informations by the culture department of the Austrian federal state of Carinthia], accessed July 1, 2018.</ref>
== Stations and artists == There are 25 stations and 65 artists represented at the project.<ref>see the guidebook of the project: [https://www.yumpu.com/de/KUNSTradln Brochure „KUNSTradln“ (in German), accessed June 1, 2018.]</ref>
'''Stations'''
* Eight stations are located in the former [[Millstatt Abbey|Millstatt abbey]], using the [[Romanesque architecture|Romanesque]] [[cloister]] and cloistered courtyard, the monastery museum, the [[Renaissance architecture|Renaissance]] [[Arcade (architecture)|arcades]], the former castle of the [[Grand Master (order)|Grand Master of the Knights of Saint George]] with the new "Lindenhof Gallery", or the monastery garden. * Six stations can be found in the centre of Millstatt, using the [[town hall]], the congress centre Millstatt, and several old bourgeois houses as exhibition points. * Eleven stations include the lakeside of [[Millstätter See|lake Millstatt]], with several sculptures at the lakefront park and [[promenade]], and presenting art in some hotels and restaurants along the lake.
'''Artists'''
The artists are representing several areas of contemporary [[visual arts]]: * [[Ceramic art]]: [[Maria Baumgartner]], [[Veronika Dirnhofer]], [[Gabriele Hain]] * Film, Video: [[Mariola Brillowska]], [[Jerzy Kucia]], [[Jochen Kuhn]], [[Hubert Sielecki]], [[Anna Vasof]] * [[Graphic arts|Graphic art]]: [[Wojtek Krzywobłocki]], [[Thomas Laubenberger-Pletzer]], [[Ingrid Neuwirth]], [[Michael Printschler]], [[Rudolf Sodek]] * [[Installation art]]: [[Brigitte Corell]], [[Regula Dettwiler]], [[Stefan Draschan]], [[Johannes Heuer]], [[Tomas Hoke]], [[Gerhard Kaiser]], [[Brigitte Kowanz]], [[Brigitte Lang]], [[Elke Maier]], [[Oswald Oberhuber]], [[Adele Razkövi]], [[Katharina Steiner]], [[Maria Temnitschka]], [[Andreas Werner]] * [[Jewellery design]]: [[Anna Heindl]] * [[Painting]]: [[Helmut Arnez]], [[Cäcilia Falk]], {{ill|Josef Floch|de}}, [[Franz Kaindl]], [[Edith Kramer]], [[Lisa Kunit]], [[Maria Lassnig]], [[Alois Mosbacher]], [[Ingrid Niedermayr]], [[Bettina Patermo]], [[Katja Praschak]], [[Gabriele Schöne]], [[Wilhelm Seibetseder]], [[Helmut Swoboda]], [[Maria Temnitschka]], [[Rudolf Vogl (VOKA)]], [[Johann Weyringer]] * [[Performance]], [[Dance]]: [[Regina José Galindo]], [[Jakob Lena Knebl]], [[Andrea Schlehwein]] * [[Photography#Art|Photography]]: [[Johannes Leitner]], [[Sang Hoon Ok]], Max Seibald, [[Mathias Swoboda]] * [[Sculpture]]: [[Amy Brier]], [[Nemanja Cvijanović]], [[Herbert Golser]], [[Clemens Heinl]], [[Robert Kabas]], [[Alois Lindenbauer]], [[Helmut Machhammer]], [[Georg Planer]], [[Egon Straszer]], [[Manfred Wakolbinger]], [[Niclas A. Walkensteiner]], [[Markus Wilfling]] * [[Textile arts|Textile art]]: [[Lore Heuermann]]E, [[Frenzi Rigling]], [[Anneliese Schrenk]], [[Frederike Schweizer]]
== References == {{reflist}}
== External links and sources == {{Commonscatinline}} * [https://www.kunstradln.at Homepage of the project (in German)], accessed June 1, 2018. * [https://www.ktn.gv.at/Service/News?nid=28432 Informations by the culture department of the Austrian federal state of Carinthia], accessed July 1, 2018. * [https://www.kleinezeitung.at/kultur/5444177/Kunstradln-in-Millstatt_Fuer-die-Kunst-in-die-Pedale-treten Newspaper article in the Austrian statewide journal "Kleine Zeitung" (in German)], accessed July 1, 2018. * [https://www.meinbezirk.at/spittal/lokales/bewegung-kunst-kuenstler-und-natur-d2652536.html Newspaper article in the Austrian regional journal "Bezirksrundschau" (in German)], accessed July 1, 2018. * Nora Leitgeb: Installation kopf.über: Katharina Steiner, in: Die Brücke. Kärntens Kulturzeitschrift, Klagenfurt, Nr. 7 Juni-Juli 2018, p. 30-31 (article in the Austrian arts and culture magazine "Die Brücke" on the project of the artist Katharina Steiner as part of "Art cycling in Millstatt") * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jIY0O2rBBy4 TV report "Art cycling in Millstatt", broadcast by the ORF (Austrian TV), June 5, 2018], accessed June 6, 2018. * [http://www.millstaettersee.com/media/prospekte/MIC-Folder-2018-WEB.pdf Millstatt Inclusive Card, page 17: short infos on "Art cycling in Millstatt" in English], accessed June 1, 2018.
{{DEFAULTSORT:Art cycling in Millstatt}} [[Category:Austrian contemporary art]] [[Category:Events in Austria]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox recurring event |name = Centrestage |native_name = |native_name_lang = |logo = |logo_alt = |logo_caption = |logo_size = |image = |image_size = |alt = |caption = |status = active |genre = Fashion trade show |date = |begins = |ends = |frequency = Annually |venue = |location = |coordinates = <!-- {{coord|LAT|LON|type:event|display=inline,title}} --> |country = [[Hong Kong]] |years_active = <!-- {{age|YYYY|mm|dd}} Date of the first occurrence --> |first = <!-- {{start date|YYYY|mm|dd}} "founded=" and "established=" also work --> |founder_name = [[Hong Kong Trade Development Council]] (HKTDC) |last = 6th - 9th September 2017 |prev = |next = |participants = Fashion brands from around the world |attendance = |capacity = |area = |budget = |activity = |leader_name = |patron = |organised = <!-- "organized=" also works --> |filing = |people = |member = |sponsor = <!-- | or sponsors = --> |website = {{URL|http://www.centrestage.com.hk}} |current = |footnotes = }}
'''Centrestage''' is an international fashion trade show organised annually by the [[Hong Kong Trade Development Council]] (HKTDC).<ref>{{cite news | last = | first = | title =Asian fashion brands captivate buyers at HK’s CENTRESTAGE | newspaper =| location = | pages = | language = | publisher =''entrepreneur.com.ph''| date = | url =http://www.entrepreneur.com.ph/news-and-events/asian-fashion-brands-captivate-buyers-at-hk-s-centrestage-a36-20160914 | accessdate =14 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | last = | first = | title =A Hong Kong tutto pronto per Centrestage | newspaper =| location = | pages = | language = | publisher =''pambianconews.com''| date = | url =http://www.pambianconews.com/2017/07/26/hong-kong-pronto-centrestage-219621/ | accessdate =14 September 2017}}</ref>
==History== The Hong Kong Trade Development Council (HKTDC) organised the first Centrestage international fashion trade show in 2016 as a new promotion and launch platform for international Asian fashion brands and designs.<ref>{{cite news | last = | first = | title =Fashion Spotlight CENTRESTAGE Opens in Hong Kong | newspaper =| location = | pages = | language = | publisher =''benzinga.com''| date = | url =https://www.benzinga.com/pressreleases/17/09/a10020566/fashion-spotlight-centrestage-opens-in-hong-kong | accessdate =14 September 2017}}</ref>
The second edition of the fashion trade show was staged from 6 to 9 September 2017 at the [[Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre]].<ref>{{cite news | last = | first = | title =“Hong Kong in Fashion” sets the scene for CENTRESTAGE | newspaper =| location = | pages = | language = | publisher =''eturbonews.com''| date =28 August 2017 | url =https://eturbonews.com/162858/hong-kong-fashion-sets-scene-centrestage | accessdate =14 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | last = | first = | title =HKTDC to host new international fashion event Centrestage | newspaper =| location = | pages = | language = | publisher =''hk.fashionnetwork.com''| date =15 July 2016 | url =http://hk.fashionnetwork.com/news/HKTDC-to-host-new-international-fashion-event-Centrestage,713913.html | accessdate =14 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | last = | first = | title =Centrestage präsentiert „Shooting Stars“ in Hongkong | newspaper =| location = | pages = | language = | publisher =''textilmitteilungen.de''| date = | url =http://www.textilmitteilungen.de/news-termine-centrestage-hong-kong/centrestage-praesentiert-shooting-stars-hongkong | accessdate =14 September 2017}}</ref> The 2017 show attracted more than 210 international and fashion brands. There were also events including runway shows, designer sharing sessions, industry seminars, networking events and more during the four-day trade show.<ref>{{cite news | last = | first = | title ="Hong Kong in Fashion" Sets the Scene for CENTRESTAGE | newspaper =| location = | pages = | language = | publisher =''en.acnnewswire.com''| date = | url =http://en.acnnewswire.com/press-release/english/38160/ | accessdate =14 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | last = | first = | title =Centrestage porte la création mode en Asie | newspaper =| location = | pages = | language = | publisher =''journaldutextile.com''| date = | url =http://www.journaldutextile.com/centrestage-porte-la-creation-mode-en-asie.html | accessdate =14 September 2017}}</ref>
==Purpose== Centrestage is organised to promote designers' collection and brands from around the world.<ref>{{cite news | last = | first = | title =There is something new in Hong Kong: Centrestage! | newspaper =| location = | pages = | language = | publisher =''collezioni.info''| date = | url =http://www.collezioni.info/en/there-is-something-new-hong-kong-centrestage/ | accessdate =14 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | last = | first = | title =CENTRESTAGE CONCLUDES WITH POSITIVITY ABOUT SALES AND BOOKINGS | newspaper =| location = | pages = | language = | publisher =''fashionatingworld.com''| date = | url =http://www.fashionatingworld.com/new1-2/centrestage-concludes-with-positivity-about-sales-and-bookings | accessdate =14 September 2017}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Hong Kong Trade Development Council]] * [[Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre]]
==References== {{reflist|2}}
[[Category:Fashion events in China]] [[Category:Trade fairs in Hong Kong]]

revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:''Charlie Hebdo'' shooting}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2017}} {{Infobox civilian attack |title=''Charlie Hebdo'' shooting |partof=the [[January 2015 Île-de-France attacks]] |image=Charlie-Hebdo-2015-11.JPG{{!}}border |alt= |caption=Police officers, emergency vehicles, and journalists at the scene two hours after the shooting |map= |map_size= |map_alt= |map_caption= |location=10 [[Rue Nicolas-Appert]], [[11th arrondissement of Paris]], France<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/societe/portfolio/2015/01/07/en-images-l-attentat-de-charlie-hebdo_4550797_3224.html|title=En images: à 11 h 30, des hommes armés ouvrent le feu rue Nicolas-Appert|work=Le Monde|date=7 January 2015}}</ref> |target=''[[Charlie Hebdo]]'' employees |coordinates={{coord|48.85925|N|2.37025|E|region:FR_type:landmark|display=inline,title}} |date=7 January 2015 |time=11:30 [[Central European Time|CET]] |timezone=[[UTC+01:00]] |type=[[Mass shooting]] |fatalities=12 |injuries=11 |perps=[[Al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula]]<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/01/14/us-france-shooting-aqap-idUSKBN0KN0VO20150114|title=Al Qaeda claims French attack, derides Paris rally|agency=Reuters|accessdate=14 January 2015|date=14 January 2015}}</ref> |perpetrators=[[#Chérif and Saïd Kouachi|Chérif and Saïd Kouachi]] |weapons= * [[Zastava M70]] AB2 rifles * [[Škorpion vz. 61]] submachine guns * Grenade or rocket launcher * [[TT pistol|Tokarev TT]] pistols<ref name="Zolja">{{cite news |last=Woolf |first=Christopher |url=http://www.pri.org/stories/2015-01-15/where-did-paris-attackers-get-their-guns |title=Where did the Paris attackers get their guns? |work=PRI The World® |location=Minneapolis, US |publisher=Public Radio International |date=15 January 2015 |accessdate=16 January 2015 |quote=The weapons seen in various images of the attackers include [[Zastava M70]] assault rifle; [[vz. 61]] submachine gun; several Russian-designed Tokarev TT pistols and a grenade or rocket launcher – probably the Yugoslav M80 Zolja.}}</ref> * [[Pump action]] [[shotgun]]<ref name=indep7jan>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/charlie-hebdo-shooting-10-killed-as-shots-fired-at-satirical-magazine-headquarters-according-to-reports-9962337.html|title=Charlie Hebdo shooting: At least 12 killed as shots fired at satirical magazine's Paris office|work=The Independent|accessdate=9 January 2015|date=7 January 2015|location=London|first1=Adam|last1=Withnall|first2=John|last2=Lichfield}}</ref> |numpart = |motive=(presumed:) Hatred for ''Hebdo's'' cartoons joking about [[Islam]]ic leaders; attempting to shut down ''Charlie Hebdo''. (Presumably inspired by [[Islamic extremism|extremist Islamic]] group [[Al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula]].)}}
<!-- Per MOS:BOLDTITLE and WP:SBE, neither the article's title nor related text appears in bold. -->On 7 January 2015 at about 11:30 local time, two brothers, Saïd and Chérif Kouachi, forced their way into the offices of the French [[List of satirical magazines|satirical weekly newspaper]] ''[[Charlie Hebdo]]'' in Paris. Armed with rifles and other weapons, they killed 12 people and injured 11 others. The gunmen identified themselves as belonging to the [[Islamist]] terrorist group [[Al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula|Al-Qaeda's branch in Yemen]], which took responsibility for the attack. [[January 2015 Île-de-France attacks|Several related attacks]] followed in the [[Île-de-France]] region on 7–9 January 2015, including the [[Hypercacher kosher supermarket siege]] where a terrorist held 19 hostages, of whom he murdered 4 [[Jews]].
France raised its [[Vigipirate]] terror alert and deployed soldiers in Île-de-France and [[Picardy]]. A major [[Manhunt (law enforcement)|manhunt]] led to the discovery of the suspects, who exchanged fire with police. The brothers took hostages at a signage company in [[Dammartin-en-Goële]] on 9 January and were shot dead when they emerged from the building firing.
On 11 January, about two million people, including more than 40 world leaders, met in Paris for a [[Republican marches|rally of national unity]], and 3.7 million people joined demonstrations across France. The phrase ''[[Je suis Charlie]]'' became a common slogan of support at the rallies and in social media. {{anchor|charlie-hebdo-issue-after-shooting}} The staff of ''Charlie Hebdo'' continued with the publication, and [[Charlie Hebdo issue No. 1178|the following issue]] print ran 7.95 million copies in six languages, compared to its typical print run of 60,000 in only French.
==Background==
===''Charlie Hebdo'' satirical works=== {{Main article|Charlie Hebdo}} [[File:Charliehebdo.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Image of 3 November 2011 cover of ''Charlie Hebdo'', renamed ''[[Charia Hebdo]]'' ("[[Sharia]] Hebdo"). The [[word balloon]] reads "100 lashes if you don't die of laughter!" with a cartoon featuring [[Muhammad]].]] ''[[Charlie Hebdo]]'' ({{IPA-fr|ʃaʁli ɛbdo|}}; French for ''Charlie Weekly'') is a [[France|French]] [[List of satirical magazines|satirical weekly newspaper]] that features cartoons, reports, [[polemic]]s, and jokes. The publication is irreverent and stridently non-conformist in tone, is strongly [[Laïcité|secularist]], [[antireligion|antireligious]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/idees/article/2013/11/20/non-charlie-hebdo-n-est-pas-raciste_3516646_3232.html|title=Non, "Charlie Hebdo" n'est pas raciste!|trans-title=No, ''Charlie Hebdo'' is not racist!|language=French|work=[[Le Monde]]|accessdate=4 March 2014 |author=Charb |date=20 November 2013}}</ref> and [[Left-wing politics|left-wing]], publishing articles that mock [[Catholicism]], [[Judaism]], [[Islam]], and various other groups as local and world news unfolds. The magazine was published from 1969 to 1981, and has been again from 1992 on.<ref name="L'Obs">{{cite news|url=http://tempsreel.nouvelobs.com/medias/20080904.OBS0048/cabu-et-val-ecrivent-a-l-obs.html |title=Cabu et Val écrivent à l'Obs|date=5 September 2008 |website=|journal=Nouvel Observateur|first1=Jean |last1=Cabu |first2=Philippe |last2=Val |accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref>
''Charlie Hebdo'' has a history of attracting controversy. In 2006, Islamic organisations under [[Hate speech laws in France|French hate speech laws]] unsuccessfully sued over the newspaper's re-publication of the [[Jyllands-Posten Muhammad cartoons controversy|''Jyllands-Posten'' cartoons of Muhammad]].<ref name="Leveque">{{cite news|last=Leveque|first=Thierry|title=French court clears weekly in Mohammad cartoon row|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2007/03/22/industry-france-cartoons-trial-dc-idUSL2212067120070322|accessdate=10 June 2013|agency=Reuters|date=22 March 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-30719057|title=Charlie Hebdo: Major manhunt for Paris gunmen|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=8 January 2015}}</ref><ref name="independent.co.uk" /> The cover of a 2011 issue retitled ''[[Charia Hebdo]]'' (French for ''[[Sharia]] Weekly''), featured a cartoon of [[Muhammad]], whose depiction is [[Depictions of Muhammad|forbidden in some interpretations of Islam]].<ref name="bbc-15550350">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-15550350|title=BBC News: Attack on French satirical paper Charlie Hebdo (2 November 2011)|publisher=BBC|date=2 November 2011|accessdate=21 December 2011}}</ref> The newspaper's office was fire-bombed and its website [[Hacker (computer security)|hacked]].<ref name="FT01">{{cite news|last=Boxel|first=James|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/75f87b24-0541-11e1-a3d1-00144feabdc0.html|title=Firebomb attack on satirical French magazine|newspaper=Financial Times |date=2 November 2011 |accessdate=19 September 2012 |registration=yes}}</ref><ref name="CHARLIE HEBDO">{{cite web |url=https://charliehebdo.wordpress.com/2011/11/03/les-sdf-du-net/|title=Les SDF du net |author=Charlie Hebdo |date=3 November 2011 |website=|accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> In 2012, the newspaper published a series of satirical cartoons of Muhammad, including nude caricatures;<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bfmtv.com/societe/charlie-hebdo-publie-pages-interieures-caricatures-mahomet-338598.html|title=Charlie Hebdo publie des caricatures de Mahomet|trans-title=''Charlie Hebdo'' publishes some caricatures of Mohammed|work=[[BFM TV]]|language=French|date=18 September 2012|accessdate=19 September 2012}}</ref><ref name="TNPR">{{cite news|url=http://news.nationalpost.com/2012/09/19/magazines-nude-mohammad-cartoons-prompt-france-to-shut-embassies-schools-in-20-countries|title=Magazine's nude Mohammad cartoons prompt France to shut embassies, schools in 20 countries|agency=Reuters|work=National Post|date=19 September 2012|accessdate=19 September 2012|author=Vinocur, Nicholas}}</ref> this came days after [[Reactions to Innocence of Muslims|a series of violent attacks on U.S. embassies]] in the Middle East, purportedly in response to the anti-Islamic film ''[[Innocence of Muslims]]'', prompting the [[Government of France|French government]] to close embassies, consulates, cultural centres, and international schools in about 20 [[Muslim world|Muslim countries]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Samuel|first=Henry|title=France to close schools and embassies fearing Mohammed cartoon reaction|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/france/9553722/France-to-close-schools-and-embassies-fearing-Mohammed-cartoon-reaction.html|accessdate=20 September 2012|newspaper=The Telegraph|date=19 September 2012|location=London}}</ref> [[Compagnies Républicaines de Sécurité|Riot police]] surrounded the newspaper's offices to protect it against possible attacks.<ref name="TNPR" /><ref name="Olga">{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/blogpost/post/charlie-hebdo-cartoons-spark-debate-over-free-speech-and-islamophobia/2012/09/19/4b3ba988-026b-11e2-9b24-ff730c7f6312_blog.html|title=Charlie Hebdo cartoons spark debate over free speech and Islamophobia|work=The Washington Post|date=19 September 2012|accessdate=19 September 2012|last=Khazan|first=Olga}}</ref>
Cartoonist [[Charb|Stéphane "Charb" Charbonnier]] had been the [[editor-in-chief]] of ''Charlie Hebdo'' since 2009.<ref name="thewire2013" /> Two years before the attack he stated, "We have to carry on until Islam has been rendered as banal as Catholicism."<ref name="CBC News">{{cite news |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/france-even-more-fractured-after-the-charlie-hebdo-rampage-1.2893262 |title=France even more fractured after the Charlie Hebdo rampage |first=Don|last=Murray |date=8 January 2015 |website=CBC News |accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> In 2013, [[al-Qaeda]] added him to its [[most wanted list]], along with three ''Jyllands-Posten'' staff members: [[Kurt Westergaard]], [[Carsten Juste]], and [[Flemming Rose]].<ref name="thewire2013">{{cite web |url=http://www.thewire.com/global/2013/03/al-qaeda-most-wanted-list/62673/ |title=Look Who's on Al Qaeda's Most-Wanted List |author=Dashiell Bennet |date=1 March 2013 |work=The Wire |accessdate=8 January 2015}}</ref><ref name="time">{{cite news |url=http://time.com/3657246/paris-charlie-hebdo-shooting/ |title=Paris Police Say 12 Dead After Shooting at Charlie Hebdo|author=Conal Urquhart |accessdate=8 January 2015 |work=Time |date=7 January 2015}}</ref><ref name="tele">{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/france/11330505/Murdered-Charlie-Hebdo-cartoonist-was-on-al-Qaeda-wanted-list.html |title=Murdered Charlie Hebdo cartoonist was on al Qaeda wanted list |first=Victoria |last=Ward |accessdate=8 January 2015 |work=The Telegraph |date=7 January 2015 |location=London}}</ref> Being a sport shooter, Charb applied for permit to be able to [[concealed carry|carry a firearm for self-defence]]. The application went unanswered.<ref name="telerama">{{cite news |url=http://www.telerama.fr/medias/antonio-fischetti-bien-sur-on-s-engueulait-a-charlie,121621.php#links-right |title=Antonio Fischetti : "Bien sûr, on s'engueulait, à 'Charlie'" |first=Nicolas |last=Delesalle |accessdate=2 September 2015 |work=Telerama.fr |date=16 January 2015 |language=French}}</ref>
Numerous violent plots related to the ''Jyllands-Posten'' cartoons were discovered, primarily targeting cartoonist Westergaard, editor Rose, and the property or employees of ''Jyllands-Posten'' and other newspapers that printed the cartoons.{{efn|1=Sources for 'Plots against' ''Jyllands-Posten'' *spiegel.de 'I Don't fear for My life'<ref>{{cite news|last=Reimann|first=Anna|title=Interview with Jyllands-Posten Editor: 'I Don't Fear for My Life'|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/europe/spiegel-online-interview-with-jyllands-posten-editor-i-don-t-fear-for-my-life-a-534859.html|accessdate=22 September 2013|newspaper=Spiegel Online International|date=12 February 2008}}</ref> *spigdel.de (newspaper?)<ref>{{cite news|first=Matthias|last=Gebauer |last2=Musharbash |first2=Yassin |url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,414669,00.html|title=Selbstmord nach versuchtem Angriff auf Chefredakteur der "Welt"|newspaper=[[Der Spiegel]]|date=5 May 2006|accessdate=16 September 2013|language=German}}</ref> *usatoday.com<ref>{{cite news|title=Yale Criticized for Nixing Muslim Cartoons in Book |date=8 September 2009 |url=https://www.usatoday.com/news/religion/2009-09-09-yale-muslim-cartoons_N.htm |newspaper=USA Today |agency=AP |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6AjBI0LYD?url=http://www.usatoday.com/news/religion/2009-09-09-yale-muslim-cartoons_N.htm |archivedate=16 September 2012 |accessdate=17 September 2013 |first=John |last=Christoffersen |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }}</ref> *ekstrabladet.dk<ref>{{cite news|url=http://ekstrabladet.dk/nyheder/krigogkatastrofer/article1072352.ece |title=Taleban truer Danmark |newspaper=[[Ekstra Bladet]] |date=20 October 2008 |accessdate=25 October 2008|first=Knud |last=Brix|language=Danish}}</ref>}} Westergaard was the subject of several attacks and planned attacks, and lives under police protection. On 1 January 2010, police used guns to stop a would-be assassin in his home,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/charlie-hebdo-paris-shooting-how-criticisms-satires-of-islam-have-sparked-violence-1.2892571|title=Charlie Hebdo Paris shooting: How criticisms, satires of Islam have sparked violence|date=7 January 2015|accessdate=13 January 2015|work=CBC News}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/8437433.stm| title=Danish police shoot intruder at cartoonist's home| publisher=BBC News| date=2 January 2010| accessdate =1 February 2010}}</ref> who was sentenced to nine years in prison.{{efn|1=For details of various incidents see: [[2006 German train bombing plot]], [[2008 Danish embassy bombing in Islamabad]], [[Hotel Jørgensen explosion]], and [[2010 Copenhagen terror plot]].}}<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-12366076| title=Denmark cartoon trial: Kurt Westergaard attacker jailed| publisher=BBC News| date=4 February 2011| accessdate =14 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Police Arrest 'Militant Islamists' Planning Attack in Denmark |first=Christian |last=Wienberg |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2010-12-29/five-people-arrested-in-denmark-sweden-under-suspicion-of-terrorist-plot.html |publisher=[[Bloomberg Television|Bloomberg]] |date=29 December 2010 |accessdate=23 March 2013}}</ref> In 2010, three men based in Norway were arrested on suspicion of planning a terror attack against ''Jyllands-Posten'' or Kurt Westergaard;
