{{Infobox concert tour | type = Concert | name = Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends | image = File:Siti Nurhaliza - Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends (Official Poster).png | image_size = 235px | border = yes | artist = [[Siti Nurhaliza]] | support_acts = [[Anggun]], [[Afgansyah Reza]], Cakra Khan, [[Faizal Tahir]], [[Jaclyn Victor]], [[Too Phat|Joe Flizzow]], [[Hafiz (Malaysian singer)|Hafiz Suip]], and SonaOne | location = [[Kuala Lumpur]], Malaysia | venue = [[Stadium Negara]] | budget = | gross = | attendance = 7000 | album = ''[[Siti Nurhaliza I]]'', ''[[Siti Nurhaliza II]]'', ''[[Cindai]]'', ''[[:ms:Safa (album)|Safa]]'', ''[[E.M.A.S]]'', ''[[Prasasti Seni]]'', ''[[Transkripsi]]'', ''[[Hadiah Daripada Hati]]'', ''[[Fragmen]]'' and ''[[Unplugged (Siti Nurhaliza album)|Unplugged]]''. | date = {{Start date|2016|4|2}} | last_show = [[Konsert Satu Suara, Vol. 2]]
(2015) | this_show = '''Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends'''
(2016) }} '''Yonder Music Live Series: Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert''' (also known as '''Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert''' or simply '''Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends''') was a single day concert by Malaysian recording artist, [[Siti Nurhaliza]]. Sponsored by [[Celcom]] and Yonder Music, the free concert was only available exclusively to Celcom users who are subscribers of the Yonder Music [[mobile app]]. It was held on 2 April 2016 and she was supported and accompanied by five Malaysian artists and three Indonesian artists. Staged at [[Stadium Negara]], the supporting acts during the night of the concert were [[Faizal Tahir]], [[Hafiz (Malaysian singer)|Hafiz Suip]], [[Jaclyn Victor]], [[Too Phat|Joe Flizzow]], and SonaOne of Malaysia and [[Afgansyah Reza]], [[Anggun]], and Cakra Khan from Indonesia.{{ref label|fn_1|note 1}} Most of the songs that were performed at the concert were taken from her own repertoire. The selected songs were performed either by Siti on her own or as a duet or as a group with the supporting artists. She also performed for the first time a "digital duet" with [[Whitney Houston]] for the song "[[Memories (Siti Nurhaliza song)|Memories]]". The concert was a success with more than 7000 attendees came to watch the concert. It received positive feedback and reviews from concert reviewers and critics who praised Siti's vocals and overall showmanship. Few days after the concert was staged, the concert's live album was available for exclusive streaming on the Yonder Music mobile app. ==Background, development, and promotion== {{Quote box|width=350px|align=left|quote="Dato’ Siti Nurhaliza & Friends is both an expression of our gratitude and utmost respect for Dato’ Siti’s contribution to the Malaysian music industry as one of the nation’s leading artist over the past two decades. The event itself marks the beginning of a second chapter, with an extraordinary band from New York City, full orchestra and a constellation of guest stars. It’s going to be the brightest of nights." |source=—[[Adam Kidron]], [[CEO]] of Yonder Music during ''Dato’ Siti Nurhaliza & Friends'''s first [[press conference]].{{cite web|title=Konsert Dato’ Siti Nurhaliza & Friends di Stadium Negara|trans-title=Dato’ Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert at Stadium Merdeka|url=http://www.budiey.com/konsert-siti-nurhaliza-friends-yonder-stadium-negara/|language=ms|author=Budiey Isma|date=March 2, 2016|work=Budiey.com|accessdate = 18 March 2016}}}} The news of the concert was first announced by Siti on 20 January 2016 during her 37th birthday celebration.{{cite web|title=Ada kejutan besar menanti peminat Siti Nurhaliza|trans-title=There is a Big Surprise Waiting for Siti Nurhaliza's Fans|url=http://bm.therakyatpost.com/buzz/2016/01/22/ada-kejutan-besar-menanti-peminat-daripada-siti-nurhaliza/|language=ms|author=Shazryn Mohd. Faizal|date=January 22, 2016|work=The Rakyat Post|accessdate = 14 March 2016}}{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Bikin Konsert Terakhir Sebelum Cuti Panjang|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza Organizes Last Concert before a Hiatus|url=http://www.mstar.com.my/hiburan/berita-hiburan/2016/01/21/siti-nurhaliza-berehat/|language=ms|author=Kemalia Othman|date=January 21, 2016|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|mStar]]|accessdate = 14 March 2016}} She originally decided to take a break from performing for major concerts in 2016.{{cite web|title=Siti terpaksa mungkir janji, jayakan konsert Mac depan|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza had to break her promise [and] perform for a concert in March|url=http://www.bharian.com.my/node/116687|language=ms|author=Zaidi Mohamad|date=January 21, 2016|work=[[Berita Harian]]|accessdate = 31 March 2016}} However, she decided to postpone her rest after she was approached by Yonder Music with the idea and the offer of organizing a special concert for her. She also revealed that this concert will be her last before an extended hiatus until July 2016 so that she can focus on her personal life after experiencing a miscarriage in 2015.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza announces exclusive concert for Yonder users in March|url=http://www.themalaymailonline.com/showbiz/article/siti-nurhaliza-announces-exclusive-concert-for-yonder-users-in-march|author=Malay Mail Staff Writer|date=January 23, 2016|work=[[Malay Mail]]|accessdate = 14 March 2016}} In the original plan, the concert was supposed to take place at the Plenary Hall of [[Kuala Lumpur Convention Center]] (KLCC) on 5 and 6 March 2016. However, after a follow-up meeting with the main organizers of the concert, the concert was later rescheduled to 2 April 2016.{{cite web|title=Ada Anggun di Konser 20 Tahun Siti Nurhaliza|trans-title=Anggun will be Present at Siti Nurhaliza's 20th Year Concert|url=https://seleb.tempo.co/read/news/2016/03/03/219750233/ada-anggun-di-konser-20-tahun-siti-nurhaliza|language=id|author=Tempo Staff Writer|date=March 3, 2016|work=[[Tempo (Indonesian magazine)|Tempo]]|accessdate = 14 March 2016}} The final date for the concert was also chosen to coincide with the celebration of her 20th year involvement in the music industry.{{cite web|title=20 years of Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://www.star2.com/entertainment/music/2016/03/11/20-years-of-siti-nurhaliza/|author=Kenneth Chaw|date=March 11, 2016|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate = 20 March 2016}} On 2 March 2016, during the concert's first press conference, more details about the concert were revealed.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza buat konsert percuma|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza organizes free concert|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/berita/nasional/siti-nurhaliza-buat-konsert-percuma-1.196516|language=ms|author=Utusan Malaysia Staff Writer|date=March 3, 2016|work=[[Utusan Malaysia]]|accessdate = 20 March 2016}} Unlike the original plan, the concert will only be held on a single day, 2 April 2016.{{cite web|title=Siti raikan Anggun di pentas konsertnya|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza celebrating Anggun at the stage of her concert|url=http://www.bharian.com.my/node/130021|language=ms|author=Muhamad Fairoz Azizan|date=March 2, 2016|work=[[Berita Harian]]|accessdate = 20 March 2016}} It will be also staged at [[Stadium Negara]] instead of KLCC. Billed as "Datuk Siti Nurhaliza & Friends", five supporting acts from Malaysia and Indonesia were also announced.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza to perform at special concert before extended hiatus|url=http://www.themalaymailonline.com/showbiz/article/siti-nurhaliza-to-perform-at-special-concert#sthash.MsqHVpXg.dpuf|author=Malay Mail Staff Writer|date=March 3, 2016|work=[[Malay Mail]]|accessdate = 20 March 2016}} Accompanied by [[Faizal Tahir]] and [[Hafiz (Malaysian singer)|Hafiz Suip]], two Malaysian singers who will be supporting her during the concert, the organizers also announced the involvement of three Indonesian singers who will be sharing the stage with Siti: [[Afgansyah Reza]], [[Anggun]], and Cakra Khan. Sponsored by [[Celcom]] and Yonder Music, tickets for the concert were not available for sale. The free concert was set to be only available exclusively for 6000 chosen Celcom users who are subscribers of the Yonder Music [[mobile app]].{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza To Perform At Special Concert Before Going On Long Break|url=http://www.bernama.com/bernama/v8/ge/newsgeneral.php?id=1221385|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160306152652/http://www.bernama.com/bernama/v8/ge/newsgeneral.php?id=1221385|archivedate=March 6, 2016|author=Bernama Staff Writer|date=March 2, 2016|work=[[BERNAMA]]|accessdate = 20 March 2016}} [[File:Siti Nurhaliza - Buat Konsert Lain Dari Yang Lain.webm|thumb|270px|right|thumbtime=0:31|Siti Nurhaliza being interviewed about her ''Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert'' by [[Neelofa]] and Nabil Ahmad for MeleTOP.]] On 23 March, a second press conference for the concert was held.{{cite web|title=Joe Flizzow, SonaOne sertai konsert Siti Nurhaliza 2 April|trans-title=Joe Flizzow and SonaOne join Siti Nurhaliza's concert on 2 April|url=http://www.bhplus.com.my/node/136835|language=ms|author=Zaidi Mohamad|date=March 24, 2016|work=[[Berita Harian]]|accessdate = 24 March 2016}} After receiving an overwhelming response from the public, the seating arrangement for the concert was revised so that it can fit an additional 1000 people, making the final number is 7000 people. Yonder Music also decided to add two more guest Malaysian artists who will be Siti's supporting acts – [[Too Phat|Joe Flizzow]] and SonaOne.{{ref label|fn_1|note 1}} She also will be accompanied by The Gotham All-Stars band and a 47-piece orchestra throughout the concert.{{cite web|title=Peminat harta Siti Nurhaliza|trans-title=Fans are Siti Nurhaliza's treasure|url=http://kosmo.com.my/kosmo/content.asp?y=2016&dt=0330&pub=Kosmo&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_03.htm|language=ms|author=Izwan Mohd. Isa|date=March 30, 2016|work=[[Kosmo!]]|accessdate = 30 March 2016}} Promotions for the concert were mostly done in late March. These were including an appearance by Siti on various electronic media. Some of the radio stations that she visited were [[Fly FM]] and [[Hot FM (Malaysia)|Hot FM]].{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza di Hot FM|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza on Hot FM|url=https://www.facebook.com/hotfm976/photos/pb.92562929270.-2207520000.1460235963./10154166815999271/?type=3&theater|language=ms|author=Hot FM's Admin|date=March 24, 2016|accessdate = 10 April 2016}}{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza on Fly FM|url=https://www.facebook.com/SitiNurhalizaOfficial/photos/pb.126837781389.-2207520000.1460236226./10153958949776390/?type=3&theater|author=Siti Nurhaliza Tarudin Official's Admin|date=March 24, 2016|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} She also made various appearances on a number of television programs including MeleTOP and hLive on a number of channels of [[Astro (television)|Astro]] [[pay television]] services.{{cite web|title=MeleTOP – Dato Siti Nurhaliza Buat Konsert Lain Dari Yang Lain Ep177 (22.3.2016)|trans-title=Dato' Siti Nurhaliza is Having an Unusual Kind of Concert Ep 177 (22.3.2016)|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q0NrWe9MoS8|language=ms|author=MeleTOP's Admin|date=March 22, 2016|accessdate = 10 April 2016}}{{cite web|title=h Live! eksklusif: Pengumuman istimewa dari Datuk Siti Nurhaliza (Video)|trans-title=h Live! Exclusive: Special Announcement by Datuk Siti Nurhaliza (Video)|url=http://www.astroawani.com/video-hiburan/h-live-eksklusif-pengumuman-istimewa-dari-datuk-siti-nurhaliza-109671|language=ms|author=Astro Awani Staff|date=March 24, 2016|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} She also appeared on [[TV3 (Malaysia)|TV3]]'s morning television show, Malaysia Hari Ini for the promotion of the concert.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza di MHI|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza at MHI|url=https://www.facebook.com/SitiNurhalizaOfficial/photos/pb.126837781389.-2207520000.1460236238./10153958004386390/?type=3&theater|language=ms|author=Siti Nurhaliza Tarudin Official's Admin|date=March 24, 2016|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} ==Performances== ===Fashion and stage=== ''Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert'' marked Siti Nurhaliza's first concert to be organized at [[Stadium Merdeka]], an enclosed indoor arena.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza janji persembahan serba baharu malam ini|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza promises all-new performances for tonight|url=http://www.bharian.com.my/node/139803|language=ms|author=Zaidi Mohamad|date=April 2, 2016|work=[[Berita Harian]]|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} Her makeup for the night was provided by Nurul Shukor while her dresses were designed and created by Rizman Ruzaini.{{cite web|title=Konsert Datuk Siti and Friends Hebat!|trans-title=Datuk Siti and Friends Concert was Great!|url=http://eh.com.my/artikel/hiburan/konsert-datuk-siti-and-friends-hebat/|language=ms|author=Eh! Magazine Staff|date=April 4, 2016|work=Eh.com.my|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} Rizman Nordin of the Rizman Ruzaini duo revealed that he was asked by Yonder Music to create "outstanding" dresses for Siti for the night.{{cite web|title=Cerita Baju Konsert Dato’ Siti Nurhaliza|trans-title=Stories about Siti Nurhaliza's Concert Dresses|url=http://eh.com.my/artikel/cerita-baju-konsert-dato-siti-nurhaliza/|language=ms|author=Khairul Abidin|date=April 5, 2016|work=Eh.com.my|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} According to him, the original colour theme for Siti's dresses was red per the request by the organizer. However, he decided that [[Gold (color)|gold]] should also be included in the dresses' palette to make Siti more outstanding. The designs for all three dresses were entrusted by Siti to the duo. For the first dress, they used a red [[Net (textile)|net cloth]] that comes with [[Motif (textile arts)|motifs]] sewn into it. For the second dress, inspired from the first time Siti worked with them, they used red [[lace]] and net to make the dress. For the final dress, which was a striped sequin gold dress with a red base and side panels,{{cite web|title=Kenangan Indah di Konsert Dato’ Siti Nurhaliza & Friends|trans-title=The Sweet Memories of Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert|url=http://www.budiey.com/ulasan-konsert-dato-siti-nurhaliza-friends/|language=ms|author=Budiey Isma|date=April 4, 2016|work=Budiey.com|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} they used fabrics that are full of [[sequins]] to make it. Few adjustments were done to the designs after they saw her during the full rehearsals of the concert, including changing the colours of her [[Tudong|tudungs]]. All three dresses were made from imported fabrics and materials. It took them three weeks to finish designing and creating all the dresses. ===Synopsis=== [[File:Siti Nurhaliza Performing Memories - Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends.jpg|thumb|right|270px|Siti Nurhaliza performing "Memories" for the first time at the ''Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert''.]] ''Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert'' has three main segments. The first segment saw her performing her songs as "[[Acoustic music|unplugged]]" while the second and her last segment saw her being accompanied by a live band and a full orchestra respectively.{{cite web|title=Siti at her best|url=http://www.thesundaily.my/news/1752253|author=Bissme S.|date=April 6, 2016|work=[[The Sun (Malaysia)|The Sun]]|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} The two-hour concert began close to 9 p.m. with an opening dance routine by a young girl which is said "to represent Siti as a young girl who dreamt of becoming an entertainer".{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza gave her fans a night to remember|url=http://www.nst.com.my/news/2016/04/136849/siti-nurhaliza-gave-her-fans-night-remember|author=Bibi Nurshuhada Ramli|date=April 3, 2016|work=[[New Straits Times]]|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} Siti later appeared on the stage to begin the "unplugged" segment of her concert with the acoustic rendition of "Aku Cinta Padamu". She later performed "Percayalah", "[[Jaga Dia Untukku]]", and "[[Terbaik Bagimu]]". In the next segment with live band, accompanied by Sonaone and [[Too Phat|Joe Flizzow]], she performed a medley of her upbeat songs – "Ku Mahu", "Ku Milikmu", and "Destinasi Cinta".{{cite web|title=Pesona 20 tahun Siti Nurhaliza|trans-title=The Charm[ing] 20 years of Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://kosmo.com.my/kosmo/content.asp?y=2016&dt=0404&pub=Kosmo&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_01.htm|language=ms|author=Izwan Mohd Isa|date=April 4, 2016|work=[[Kosmo!]]|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} She later invited on stage [[Anggun]] to perform a duet with Anggun's own song, "[[Snow on the Sahara (song)|Snow on the Sahara]]". They later sang together Siti's own song, "Bukan Cinta Biasa".{{cite web|title='Terima kasih sayangku'|trans-title='Thank you, my love'|url=https://www.malaysiakini.com/hiburan/336314|language=ms|author=Nadia Azam|date=April 3, 2016|work=[[Malaysiakini]]|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} She closed the live band segment with "Cindai", her traditional song that was reworked with a more modern music arrangement for the concert.{{cite web|title=Ekspresi cinta Siti Nurhaliza|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza's expression of love|url=http://www.sinarharian.com.my/hiburan/ekspresi-cinta-siti-nurhaliza-1.505559|language=ms|author=Haslina Kamaluddin|date=April 3, 2016|work=[[Sinar Harian]]|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} For the second half of the concert, she was accompanied by a full orchestra for the remaining songs of the set list. The orchestra segment began with the performance of "Memories", a previously unreleased song by [[Whitney Houston]].{{cite web|title=Memukau, Konsert Lima Bintang Siti Nurhaliza Sebelum Berehat Panjang|trans-title=Impressive. A Five-Star Concert [by] Siti Nurhaliza before Hiatus|url=http://www.mstar.com.my/hiburan/berita-hiburan/2016/04/03/konsert-siti-friends/|language=ms|author=Jemang Rahman|date=April 3, 2016|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|mStar]]|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} Recorded by Whitney in 1982, the unreleased song was given to Siti by Yonder Music. For the concert, it was performed as a "digital duet" where Siti sang as a duet with prerecorded Whitney's vocals. She credited Whitney for teaching her about proper vocal techniques before singing few lines from "[[I Will Always Love You#Whitney Houston version|I Will Always Love You]]" [[a cappella]]. She later performed "[[Jerat Percintaan]]", her first single that was composed by [[Adnan Abu Hassan|Datuk Adnan Abu Hassan]] as a tribute to him after he died a few weeks before the concert on 18 March 2016. Next, she performed two of her duet songs with two male singers who have originally recorded the two songs with her respectively. She first sang with [[Hafiz (Malaysian singer)|Hafiz Suip]] for "[[Muara Hati]]" before proceeding with another duet with Cakra Khan for "[[Seluruh Cinta]]". She then proceeded the show with the performance of "Menatap dalam Mimpi" and a medley of "Seindah Biasa" and "Kau Sangat Bererti". After the medley, she called on stage [[Faizal Tahir]] for the duet performance of "Bagaikan Sakti". After the duet, she briefly recalled the memories of her late father before tearing up since he was not there "to witness this momentous moment" with her.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza menangis kenang arwah abah|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza Cried [when] she remembers [her] late father|url=http://www.malaysiagazette.com/ms/hiburan/siti-nurhaliza-menangis-kenang-arwah-abah|language=ms|author=Malaysia Gazette Staff|date=April 4, 2016|work=MalaysiaGazette.com|accessdate = 10 April 2016}}{{efn|Original:"''untuk menyaksikan detik bersejarah ini''"}} After the brief recollection, she was joined by [[Afgansyah Reza]] for the performance of "[[Biarlah Rahsia]]" before closing the orchestra segment of the concert with solo performance of "[[Lebih Indah]]". After she exited the stage, she later was accompanied by all her guest artists including [[Jaclyn Victor]] to the stage for the encore performance of "[[Kau Ilhamku]]". Throughout the concert, for every break and Siti's dress change, prerecorded video interviews with individuals who are closed with Siti were shown on the large screen at the back. Individuals who were interviewed were including her close family members, friends, colleagues, and even her former school teachers. At the end of the concert, music video for "Memories" was also shot and recorded for later release.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza buktikan keunggulan dalam konsert istimewa|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza proves [her] greatness in a special concert|url=http://www.bharian.com.my/node/139947|language=ms|author=Zaidi Mohamad|date=April 3, 2016|work=[[Berita Harian]]|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} ==Critical response== Vocal performances and overall showmanship of Siti and her duet partners were subjects of critics' appraisals. Although this concert marked Siti's first collaboration with Anggun, their duet performances were highly praised. Nadia Azam of ''[[Malaysiakini]]'' reviewed that Siti's duet with Anggun was "the most awaited performance of the night"{{efn|Original:"''Bahagian paling menarik pada persembahan malam tadi [...]''"}} and Nor Amirah Mahmuddin of ''[[BERNAMA|Youth Bernama]]'' called the pair as a "unique combination".{{cite web|title=Konsert Dua Dekad Siti Nurhaliza Cipta Sejarah|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza's Two Decade Concert Creates A History|url=http://youth.bernama.com/v2/news.php?id=1232498|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160413090453/http://youth.bernama.com/v2/news.php?id=1232498|archivedate=April 13, 2016|author=Nor Amirah Mahmuddin|date=April 6, 2016|work=[[BERNAMA|Youth BERNAMA]]|accessdate = 13 April 2016}}{{efn|Original:"''gabungan unik''"}} Izwan Mohd Isa of ''[[Kosmo!]]'' commented that their vocals for the two duets of "[[Snow on the Sahara (song)|Snow on the Sahara]]" and "Bukan Cinta Biasa" were "utterly breathtaking".{{efn|Original:"''sangat memukau''"}} Bissme S. of ''The Sun'' also shared the same sentiment. He commented, "Sometimes, when you have a duet with two skilled singers, things can go terribly wrong. They may try to upstage one other. Thankfully, that did not happen here. Anggun and Siti complemented each other perfectly. It was just two good friends having a good time on stage." He also favoured Siti's duet with another Indonesian singer, Afgansyah Reza for "[[Biarlah Rahsia]]". He commented, "The combination of his raspy voice and her powerful vocals provided a unique and interesting flavour for the evening." He also reviewed that Siti's duet with Faizal Tahir for "Bagaikan Sakti" was "memorable" and he "managed to put his own personality into the song." Siti's duets with Cakra Khan and [[Hafiz (Malaysian singer)|Hafiz Suip]] for "[[Seluruh Cinta]]" and "[[Muara Hati]]" respectively were reviewed positively by Nor Amirah Mahmuddin of ''Youth Bernama'' who stated that Siti's vocals blended really well with her singing partners. Siti's "digital duet" with Whitney Houston for the debut live performance of "Memories" was reviewed favourably by the critics. Siti Athirah Dzulkifly of ''[[Utusan Malaysia]]'' called the duet as "unique",{{cite web|title=Signifikan dua dekad Siti Nurhaliza|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza's Two Decades of Significance|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/hiburan/selebriti/signifikan-dua-dekad-siti-nurhaliza-1.232728|language=ms|author=Siti Athirah Dzulkifly|date=April 10, 2016|work=[[Utusan Malaysia]]|accessdate = 13 April 2016}} Bissme S. of ''The Sun'' reviewed it as "one of the highlights of the night", and Jemang Rahman of ''[[The Star (Malaysia)|mStar]]'' praised it as "Siti continues to spellbind thousands of her audience with her impressive vocals"{{efn|Original:"''Siti terus memukau ribuan penonton dengan vokal mantapnya [...]''"}} and "will be remembered by the audience".{{efn|Original:"''amat terkesan diingatan penonton''"}} Bissme S. of ''The Sun'', however, reviewed negatively the opening act of the dancing young girl. He criticized the routine as "tame, lame and dull" and "I think the concept didn’t work out as intended. Instead of enchanting everyone, this act made the crowd restless. We couldn’t wait for the dancing to stop and the music to begin." He later added that Siti "saved the day" when she appeared on the stage and "from that point on, the concert was a roller coaster ride of pure entertainment." Overall, ''Dato Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert'' received positive reviews and feedback from critics and concert reviewers. Haslina Kamaludin of ''[[Sinar Harian]]'' in her review stated, "IMPRESSIVE! That is what [one] can say after watching the ''Dato Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert''. Overall, this concert deserves to be given five stars. From the aspect of its lighting, musicians, music arrangements, and her vocals, there are nothing left to be argued."{{efn|Original:"''MANTAP! Hanya itu yang boleh diungkapkan usai menonton Konsert Datuk Siti Nurhaliza & Friends. Secara keseluruhan, konsert ini layak diberikan lima bintang. Daripada segi pencahayaan, pemuzik, susunan muzik dan vokal penyanyi ini tidak ada yang perlu dipertikaikan lagi.''"}} A number of reviewers also echoed Haslina's review that the event is a 5-star concert. Izwan Mohd Isa of ''Kosmo!'' in his review stated, "[...] In the 20 years that she has steered her career as a vocalist, this 37 years old woman has also never failed in placing herself among the best, until the point she was able to receive the "seal of approval" as the nation's number one singer by the public."{{efn|Original:"''[...] dalam tempoh 20 tahun menakhodakan karier sebagai pelantun suara, wanita berusia 37 tahun itu juga belum pernah gagal meletakkan dirinya antara yang terbaik, sehingga melayakkan beliau menerima ‘cop mohor’ sebagai penyanyi nombor satu negara daripada khalayak.''"}} He concluded his review with:
From the music arrangements, sound [system], stage organization and lighting techniques, Yonder Music has successfully created a fresh environment to visualize Siti's 20 years in the industry. This concert henceforth has become a benchmark for Siti as a credible entertainer who deserves to fly high in the music stratosphere for more than 20 years. May she live long with her career [continues] to 'mature' and [becomes more] profound.{{efn|Original:"''Dari segi susunan muzik, bunyi, susun atur pentas dan teknik pencahayaan, pihak Yonder Music berjaya mewujudkan suasana segar bagi menggambarkan usia 20 tahun Siti bergelar anak seni. Konsert ini sekali gus menjadi penanda aras buat Siti sebagai penghibur berkredibiliti yang memang layak terbang tinggi di angkasa seni selama 20 tahun. Semoga Siti lanjut usia dengan karier yang lebih ‘masak’ dan hebat.''"}}
==Broadcast and recording== For fans who could not attend the show, the concert was made available for streaming on ESCAPE by Celcom during the night of the concert.{{cite web|title='Live Stream' Konsert Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Secara Percuma di ESCAPE|trans-title=Live Stream Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert for Free on ESCAPE|url=https://www.facebook.com/xpaxfb/photos/a.111010147790.109394.61082712790/10153384026382791/?type=3&theater|language=ms|author=Xpax's Admin|date=April 1, 2016|accessdate = 10 April 2016}} Few days after the event, a live album for the concert was made available for streaming on the Yonder Music mobile app for its subscribers. The live concert also aired on [[Astro Ria]] (Channel 104/123) on December 11, 2016 at 9pm.[http://www.pressreader.com/malaysia/utusan-borneo-sarawak/20161211/281539405589124 Konsert Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends di Astro Ria malam ini (Dato’ Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert on Astro Ria tonight)] Press Reader, Utusan Borneo Sarawak (11 December 2016). Retrieved on 15 December 2016. ==Set list== [[File:Siti Nurhaliza - Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends' Artists.jpg|thumb|right|400px|Siti Nurhaliza and her guest artists for ''Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Concert''. From left, [[Faizal Tahir]], Sonaone, [[Too Phat|Joe Flizzow]], [[Afgansyah Reza]], [[Siti Nurhaliza]], [[Anggun]], [[Jaclyn Victor]], Cakra Khan and [[Hafiz (Malaysian singer)|Hafiz Suip]].]] {{div col|colwidth=30em}} # Act 1: Acoustic/Unplugged ## "Aku Cinta Padamu" ## "Percayalah" ## "[[Jaga Dia Untukku]]" ## "[[Terbaik Bagimu]]" # Act 2: Band ## Medley (Duet with [[Too Phat|Joe Flizzow]] and SonaOne) ### "Ku Mahu" ### "Ku Milikmu" ### "Destinasi Cinta" ## "[[Snow on the Sahara (song)|Snow on the Sahara]]" (Duet with [[Anggun]]) ## "Bukan Cinta Biasa" (Duet with Anggun) ## "Cindai" # Act 3: Full Orchestra ## "Memories (Duet with [[Whitney Houston]]) ## "[[Jerat Percintaan]]" ## "[[Muara Hati]]" (Duet with [[Hafiz (Malaysian singer)|Hafiz Suip]]) ## "[[Seluruh Cinta]]" (Duet with Cakra Khan) ## "Menatap dalam Mimpi" ## 20th Anniversary Medley ### "Seindah Biasa" ### "Kau Sangat Bererti" ## "Bagaikan Sakti" (Duet with [[Faizal Tahir]]) ## "[[Biarlah Rahsia]]" (Duet with [[Afgansyah Reza]]) ## "[[Lebih Indah]]" # Encore ## "[[Kau Ilhamku]]" (Duet with all guest artists) {{div col end}} Source: Adapted from concert's [[press release]].Yonder Music & Siti Nurhaliza Productions (2016) "Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends'' (Press Release) Yonder Music & Siti Nurhaliza Productions. ==Commercial performance== The free concert was officially announced on 2 March 2016. Since the tickets are not for sale, fans have to be subscribers and users of Celcom mobile communication service and Yonder Music mobile app respectively to stand a chance to win a pair of tickets per individual.{{cite web|title=Surprises at Datuk Siti Nurhaliza concert|url=http://malaysiagazette.com/en/entertainment/surprises-datuk-siti-nurhaliza-concert|author=Arif Nizam Abdullah|date=March 26, 2016|work=MalaysiaGazette.com|accessdate = 30 March 2016}} Originally available to 6000 people, the seating arrangement for the concert was revised so that the stadium can fit an additional 1000 people. Adam Kidron, the CEO of Yonder Music commented on the addition as, "We felt the responsibility to answer the call of thousands of music fans that wanted their spot at the concert and worked tirelessly with stage and production crews on an adaptation of the event design in order to accommodate more fans".{{cite web|title=Expanded Capacity For Attendees at Datuk Siti Nurhaliza & Friends' Concert|url=http://youth.bernama.com/v2/news.php?id=1229419&c=0|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160330183014/http://youth.bernama.com/v2/news.php?id=1229419&c=0|archivedate=March 30, 2016 |author=Khaliq Radzi|date=March 28, 2016|work=[[BERNAMA|Youth BERNAMA]]|accessdate = 20 March 2016}} Until 22 March 2016, it was revealed that more than 6300 tickets have been redeemed. On the night of the concert, it was reported more than 7000 people actually attended the event. ==Footnote== * '''Note 1:''' {{note|fn_1}} [[Jaclyn Victor]]'s involvement as a guest artist for the concert has never been announced in either press conference (2 March and 23 March). It is possible that she was a last minute addition to the guest artist list. ==Explanatory notes== {{notelist}} ==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20160402184236/http://www.celcomescape.com/event/siti-and-friends-concert Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends Live Streaming (Archived)] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20160402184621/https://www.xpax.com.my/siticoncert Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Friends' Terms and Conditions (Archived)] {{Siti Nurhaliza}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dato' Siti Nurhaliza and Friends Concert}} [[Category:2016 in music]] [[Category:Concerts]] [[Category:Siti Nurhaliza concert tours]]

[[File:Delmart Vreeland Note.jpg|thumb|right|220px|Delmart Vreeland note.]]
'''Delmart "Mike" Vreeland''' (born March 20, 1966 in [[Mason, Michigan]]){{Citation needed|date=May 2014}} became notable for claiming to predict the events of [[September 11, 2001]].
Vreeland, wanted by police in eight Michigan jurisdictions for crimes like fraud and burglary was arrested in [[Iowa]]'s [[Franklin County, Iowa|Franklin County]] on October 20, 2004. According to Sheriff's Deputies, Vreeland ran an identity theft ring in the [[Detroit]] area for a few years and had felony convictions for breaking and entering and receiving stolen property. Shortly after the September 11 attacks, Vreeland apparently claimed that he wrote a note that foreshadowed those events while he was in prison.
Vreeland is reported to be a folk hero among [[conspiracy theorists]] who believe he is a spy for the [[Office of Naval Intelligence]]. Government officials denied that Vreeland ever served in the Navy.<ref name="Detroit News">{{cite news |url=http://www.clickondetroit.com/news/3843181/detail.html |title=Man Who Says He Predicted Sept. 11 Attacks Arrested - Michigan Native Wanted On Child Prostitution, Fraud Charges |date=22 October 2004 |work=clickondetroit.com |publisher=Detroit News |accessdate=11 June 2010 |quote=Oakland County Sheriff's Deputy Michael Bouchard told the paper that Vreeland ran an identity theft ring in the Detroit area for a few years and has felony convictions for breaking and entering and receiving stolen property. He's reportedly considered a folk hero among conspiracy theorists who believe he is a spy for the Office of Naval Intelligence. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101231203502/http://www.clickondetroit.com/news/3843181/detail.html |archivedate=31 December 2010 |df= }}</ref> Vreeland's various claims have included knowing the cause of death of a Canadian Embassy employee before it was officially released, working as an undercover American naval officer, and being the victim of a conspiracy of government officials attempting to keep him quiet. Police officers have reportedly characterized Vreeland as "a skilled con".<ref name="Shephard">{{cite news|url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/thestar/access/723255531.html?dids=723255531:723255531&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Oct+24%2C+2004&author=Michelle+Shephard&pub=Toronto+Star&desc=Fugitive+nabbed+after+2+years+on+run%3B+Man+claims+to+have+foreseen+9%2F+11+Has+more+than+22+aliases%2C+police+say&pqatl=google|title=Fugitive nabbed after 2 years on run; Man claims to have foreseen 9/ 11 Has more than 22 aliases, police say|last=Shephard|first=Michelle|date=24 October 2004|work=Toronto Star - Toronto, Ont.|accessdate=11 June 2010}}</ref>
In 2008, Vreeland was sentenced in [[Colorado]] to 336 years to life in prison after he was convicted of inducement of child prostitution, sexual assault, sexual exploitation of children and distribution of cocaine following his luring of two boys to perform sexual acts on-camera in exchange for cocaine, money and the promise of a drum kit.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thedenverchannel.com/news/17795985/detail.html?rss=den|title=International Criminal Gets Prison For Child Sex Crimes; Delmart Vreeland Claimed To Have Advance Knowledge Of Sept. 11 Attacks|date=24 October 2008|work=TheDenverChannel.com|accessdate=14 January 2011}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links==
{{DEFAULTSORT:Vreeland, Delmart}} [[Category:People associated with the September 11 attacks]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1966 births]] [[Category:9/11 conspiracy theories]] [[Category:People from Mason, Michigan]]

{{italic title}} '''''Drot og marsk''''' (''King and Marshal'') is an [[opera]] by the [[Denmark|Danish]] composer [[Peter Heise]]. The [[libretto]], by [[Christian Richardt]], is based on [[Carsten Hauch]]'s play ''Marsk Stig'' (1850). The opera was first performed at the Royal Theatre, [[Copenhagen]], on 25 September 1878.
==Roles== {| class="wikitable" !Role !Voice type !Premiere cast |- |King Erik |[[tenor]] | |- |Marshal Stig | | |- |Fru Ingeborg | | |- |Rane Johnsen | | |- |Count Jakob | | |- |Jens Grand | | |- |Arved Bengsten | | |- |Aase | | |- |}
==Synopsis== The opera is based on the true story of the murder of the Danish king [[Eric V of Denmark|Eric Glipping]] in 1286. The king is an inveterate womaniser and when he seduces Ingeborg, the wife of [[Stig Andersen Hvide|Marshal Stig]], the marshal organises a conspiracy to kill him. Stig is banished and Ingeborg commits suicide.
==Recordings== *''Drot og marsk'', [[Poul Elming]], Bent Norup, [[Eva Johansson]], [[Aage Haugland]], Danish National Radio Choir and Royal Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Michael Schønwaldt (Chandos)
==Sources== *''The Viking Opera Guide'' ed. Holden (Viking, 1993) *''The Penguin Guide to Opera on Compact Discs'' (1993)
[[Category:Danish-language operas]] [[Category:1878 operas]] [[Category:Operas by Peter Heise]] [[Category:Operas]] [[Category:Operas based on plays]] [[Category:Operas set in the 13th century]] [[Category:Operas based on real people]] [[Category:Operas set in Denmark]] [[Category:Danish Culture Canon]]

revision.text:
{{for|the cultural movement|Freetekno}} {{Multiple issues| {{unreferenced|date=June 2008}} {{original research|date=June 2008}} }}
{{DIY party}}
'''Free tekno''', also known as '''freetekno''' and '''hardtek''',<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://techno.org/electronic-music-guide/hardtechno.swf|title=Ishkur's guide|author=Ishkur|accessdate=19 June 2016}}</ref> is the name given to the music predominantly played at [[Free party|free parties]] in Europe. The spelling of the word tekno is made to deliberately differentiate the musical style from that of [[techno]]. The music is fast, normally 170 to 200 [[beats per minute|bpm]] and characterised by a pounding repetitive [[bass drum|kick drum]].<ref>Dover, Wanz [http://www.dallasobserver.com/music/10-dance-music-documentaries-that-will-make-you-an-expert-7081404 10 Dance Music Documentaries That Will Make You an Expert] ''Dallas Observer''. July 25, 2015</ref> Nevertheless, bass drum distortion by [[clipping (audio)|clipping]] is used less often as in the related genre of [[mainstream hardcore|mainstyle hardcore]]. Nowadays, some tekno producers also use drum sets that rather sound [[trance (music)|trancey]], since many members of the tekno subculture as well as the [[psytrance]] subculture frequently attend the same [[rave|raves]] and the two scenes are closely connected.
==History== Tekno evolved in tandem with the [[teknival]] movement in the early 1990s since many of the teknival organisers and DJs were also making music. The music drew on influences such as [[Hardcore (electronic dance music genre)|hardcore]], [[rave]], [[Oldschool jungle|jungle]], [[early hardcore]] and [[techno]], with the producers taking the sound in a darker direction. Spiral tribe were the first to start making and widely disseminating this genre taking it to France and Eastern Europe after the Criminal Justice act was implemented in the UK. An emphasis is placed on samples from TV shows, films and popular culture which are placed at strategic moments in the tracks. The music was produced with whatever was available: [[drum machines]], [[synthesisers]] and [[Keyboard instrument|keyboards]] as well as computer programs such as audio/MIDI sequencers and [[Music tracker|Trackers]], sometimes even hitting a random table with a pen. Starting from year 2001 there has been a trend using laptop and laptops for live performances, because the capabilities of both the hardware and software were improving very quick.
With the evolution of the genre it has come to be known by a number of names, including '''spiral tekno''', '''hardtek''', '''tribetek''', tribe and lately evolved in many other subgenres like pumping tek, hardfloor and French core which is a sort of mixture between mainstream Hardcore and Hardtekno, with funny and pumping samples taken from different media supports.
Tekno producers come from numerous places, particularly in [[Europe]], including the [[United Kingdom]], the [[Netherlands]], [[Italy]], [[France]], [[Germany]], [[Austria]] and the [[Czech Republic]]. Some of the most active artist who from the early 90's up till the mid 2000s were [[Spiral Tribe]], Crystal Distortion, Lego, Liqitex, 69db, Ixy, Kaos, Jack Acid, Curley, Unit Moebius, Les Boucles Etranges, Yale, FKY, Babyon Joke, Arobass, Gotek, Floxytek, Suburbass, Zone-33, Mat Weasel Buster, Narkotek, Kernel Panik, Revolt99, Infrabass, Vinka, Banditos, Diablo (LSDF), Teknambul, Spiralheadz, Asphalt-Pirates, Aya Soundsystem, Puissance K, Guigoo, Billx, Maissouille, Key Gen, Psychospores, Fractal, Sceletor, and Lyzor-sak.
Many record labels contributed spreading the sound mostly via underground distribution operated mostly by record shops / labels such as Hokus Pokus (Paris) and Toolbox Records (Paris), and record labels such as Tek No Logique (TNL), Narkotek and Astrofonik. Here a list of some of the most active record labels [[Network 23 (record label)|Network 23]] record label [[Spiral Tribe]] [[Sound system (DJ)|sound system]], Hokus Pokus, Passe Muraille, Perce Oreille, Infrabass, KGB Records, OQP Crue Production, dSP records, Tek No Logique, Narkotek, Astrofonik, Le Diable Au Corps.
Artists within this genre usually follow a very different ideology when compared to more modern and mainstream producers: * Artists often use many pseudonyms, as they are not interested in mainstream success or recognition * Most are not interested in profit * They also support the free distribution of their works, as they do not see it as their own material, but as something that belongs to the fans and the community This is described as "returning to the roots".
==Subgenres==
'''Jungletek''' and '''Raggatek''' is a subgenres derived directly from Hardtek. These well known genres collide to create fast energetic 190 BPM dance floor smashers. Kicked of around 2008 here in the UK Mandidextrous & Vandal were among the first producers to start writing this genre of music. It breathed new life into the underground rave scene not only here in the UK but also picking up a strong following in Italy, Spain and Austria to mention a few. Massive influence for this music also came from the Techno scene in Europe where some of the first underground music lovers started to up the bpm and add variations in structure thus becoming Tekno. Techno in the UK in the early 90’s was based on a bpm of 130-140. By the 00’s music on its never ending journey of progression had gained more speed and Hardtek was starting to dominate UK raves especially in the South and London.. Even Trance had progressed from sweeping delicate melody’s to whats now known as Hardtrance a faster, harder more bouncy music to its predecessor. Music all over the underground was getting harder and faster. In today’s world the most recent and noticeable evaluation in music is the progression of DnB into Neuro Funk, very similar to DnB but with grittier and harsher bass and synth sounds often using masses of compression to get those tearing bass line which is now worlds apart from one of the original DnB genres pioneered by Carl Cox Jungletechno.
'''Raggatek''' is predominantly influenced by Reggae and Ragga music, incorporating Jungle, DnB, Dancehall, Reggae, Ragga and Techno music. Well known MC’s such as YT and Top Cat are a massive influence on the world of Raggatek. Producers loving this type of sound wanted to bring it to the dance floors of the underground. Upping the bpm to between 180 – 200 adding amen breaks and the basic structure of Hardtek that kick bass kick bass format was the formula for a new hybrid music. The big sounding Ragga style vocals are often a massive presence on Raggatek productions.
'''Jungletek''' works on exactly the same formula as Raggatek just replace the Ragga with Jungle & DnB. Being less known for the vocal arrangements and more about the bass lines. Jungletek takes the basics of the bass line from well known Jungle and DnB tracks and recreates them in a Hardtek format. Original productions also use the simple format of kick bass with amen breaks. European Raggatek and Jungletek is often recognisable by the high energy eletro sounds in the bass lines and synth melody’s.
==Sound systems== *[[Spiral Tribe]] *[[Network 23 (record label)]]
==External links== *[http://www.bbc.co.uk/dna/h2g2/A3647649 Free Party article at h2g2] *[http://www.freetekno.org/ Freetekno.org website] *[http://archive.freeteknomusic.org/ freetekno stable archive] *[http://parties.are.free.fr/ French tekno website (almost all in French)] *[http://www.defcore.net French free tekno website (in French)] *[http://www.freetekno.cz/ Czech freetekno website] *[http://www.underave.net/ Barcelona freetekno website] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20140328010833/http://www.aukeecrew-tekno.com/ Milwaukee freetekno website]
==References== {{Reflist}}

revision.text:
{{good article}} [[File:Fur bearing trout. Very rare. (3793949065).jpg|thumb|A mounted "fur-bearing trout" like the one once displayed in the [[National Museum of Scotland]]]] The '''fur-bearing trout''' (or '''furry trout''') is a [[legendary creature|fictional creature]] purportedly found in [[North America]] and [[Iceland]]. According to tales, the [[trout]] has created a thick coat of [[fur]] to maintain its body heat. Tales of furry fish date to the 17th-century and later the "shaggy trout" of Iceland. The earliest known American publication dates from a 1929 ''Montana Wildlife'' magazine article by J.H. Hicken. A [[taxidermy]] furry trout produced by Ross C. Jobe is a specimen at the [[Royal Museum of Scotland]]; it is a trout with white rabbit fur "ingeniously" attached.
There are no real examples of any fur-bearing trout species, but two examples of hair-like growths on fish are known. The "cotton mold", ''[[Saprolegnia]]'', can infect fish, which can result in the appearance of fish covered in the white "fur". A real fish, ''[[Mirapinna esau]]'', also known as the "Hairy Fish", has hair-like outgrowths and wings.
== Commonalities == Fur-bearing trout are [[legendary creature|fictional creatures]] that are purportedly found in [[Arkansas]], northern [[North America]], and [[Iceland]].<ref name="moh" /> The basic claim (or [[tall tale]]) is that the waters of lakes and rivers in the area are so cold that they [[evolved]] a thick coat of [[fur]] to maintain their body heat.<ref name="moh" /> Another theory says that it is due to four jugs - or two bottles<ref>{{cite web|url=http://americanfolklore.net/folklore/2010/08/furbearing_trout.html|title=Fur-Bearing Trout: From Tall tales at Americanfolklore.net|publisher=American Folklore|accessdate=1 May 2014}}</ref> - of [[hair tonic]] being spilled into the [[Arkansas River]].<ref name="moh">{{cite web|url=http://www.museumofhoaxes.com/photos/furtrout.html|title=The Fur-Bearing Trout|publisher=The Museum of Hoaxes|accessdate=1 May 2014}}</ref>
The origins vary, but one of the earlier claims date to a 17th-century Scottish immigrant's letter to his relatives referring to "furried animals and fish" being plentiful in the New World. It was followed by a request to procure a specimen of these "furried fish" and one was sent home.<ref name="moh" /> A publication in 1900 recounts the Icelandic Lodsilungur, another haired trout, as being a common folklore.<ref name=type /> The earliest known American publication dates from a 1929 ''Montana Wildlife'' magazine article by J.H. Hicken.<ref name="fmca" />
The "cotton mold" ''[[Saprolegnia]]'' will sometimes infect fish, causing tufts of fur-like growth to appear on the body. A heavy infection will result in the death of the fish, and as the fungus continues to grow afterwards, dead fish that are largely covered in the white "fur" can occasionally be found washed ashore.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.tdsfb.org/fungus.htm | title=Fish Fungus Saprolegnia & Ulcerative Dermal Necrosis (UDN) | publisher=Tay District Salmon Fisheries Board | accessdate=1 May 2014 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140502033447/http://www.tdsfb.org/fungus.htm | archivedate=May 2, 2014 | df=mdy-all }}</ref> A real fish, ''[[Mirapinna esau]]'' known as the "Hairy Fish", has hair-like outgrowths and wings. It was discovered in the [[Azores]] in 1956.<ref name=type />
== Icelandic Lodsilungur == According to Icelandic legend, the Lodsilungur (''{{illm|Loðsilungur|is}}'') is a furry trout that is the creation of demons and giants. The Lodsilungur are described as inedible fish that overwhelm rivers and are a form of punishment for human wickedness.<ref name=type>{{cite book | url=https://books.google.com/?id=QNFR4xHHIegC&printsec=frontcover&dq=The+Beasts+that+Hide+from+Man:+Seeking+the+World%27s+Last+Undiscovered+Animals#v=snippet&q=trout&f=false | title=The Beasts That Hide from Man: Seeking the World's Last Undiscovered Animals | publisher=Cosimo, Inc. | author=Shuker, Karl | year=2003 | pages=130–131 | isbn=978-1-931044-64-6}}</ref> In 1900, ''The Scottish Review'' featured an account of the Lodsilungur as a poisonous "Shaggy trout" of northern Iceland. In 1854, a shaggy trout was "cast on shore at Svina-vatn" and featured in an 1855 illustration in ''Nordri'', a newspaper.<ref name="ice2">{{cite book | url=https://archive.org/details/scottishreview01unkngoog | title=The Scottish Review | author=Gardner, Alexander | year=1900|accessdate=1 May 2014}}</ref> It was described as having a reddish hair on its lower jaw and neck, sides and fins, but the writer of the ''Nordri'' article did not specifically identify it by name.<ref name=ice2 /> [[Sjón]], a popular Icelandic writer, became obsessed with the folk tale when he was nine.<ref name=news /> Sjón recounted that if a man were to eat the furry trout he would become pregnant and that his scrotum would have to be cut open to deliver the baby.<ref name="news">{{cite web | url=http://www.newsweek.com/2013/05/15/sjons-american-invasion-237354.html | title=Sjón's American Invasion | publisher=Newsweek | date=May 15, 2013 | accessdate=1 May 2014 | author=So, Jimmy}}</ref><ref name=sjon /> Sjón noted that the story "might explain why I was later propelled towards surrealism."<ref name=sjon>{{cite web | url=http://www.theparisreview.org/blog/2013/05/16/sjon-bjork-and-the-furry-trout/ | title=Sjón, Björk, and the Furry Trout | publisher=The Paris Review | date=May 16, 2013 | accessdate=1 May 2014 | author=Bukszpan, David}}</ref>
{{Use mdy dates|date=May 2014}}
== United States furry trout == An account of a furry trout appeared in 1929 in ''Montana Wildlife'' magazine and was first noted by J.H. Hicken. Hicken's account states that when the fish is caught "the change of temperature from this water to atmosphere is so great that the fish explodes upon being taken from the water, and fur and skin come off in one perfect piece, making it available for commercial purposes, and leaving the body of the fish for refrigerator purposes or eating, as desired."<ref name="fmca">{{cite web | url=http://www.fmca.com/conventions/past-conventions/gillette-2013/3649-roaming-wyoming-furry-fish-are-cool-very-cool?tmpl=component&print=1&page= | title=Roaming Wyoming: Furry fish are cool. Very cool. | publisher=Fmca.com | accessdate=May 1, 2014 | author=Jordan, Peggy | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140409162702/http://fmca.com/conventions/past-conventions/gillette-2013/3649-roaming-wyoming-furry-fish-are-cool-very-cool?tmpl=component&print=1&page= | archivedate=April 9, 2014 | df=mdy-all }}</ref>
[[My Ten Years in a Quandary, and How They Grew]], A 1936 bestselling book by [[Robert Benchley]], contains the humorous essay "Bad News" about a report of fur-bearing trout used as a [[goiter]] cure <ref name="guta">{{cite web | url=http://gutenberg.net.au/ebooks07/0700431h.html | title=My Ten Years in a Quandary AND HOW THEY GREW | author = Benchley, Robert | publisher=gutenberg.net.au | accessdate=June 4, 2017}}</ref>
Another fur-bearing trout story originated with Wilbur Foshay, secretary of the Chamber of Commerce.<ref name=ch /><ref name=fbt1>{{cite web | url=http://www.furbearingtrout.com/cheiftan.html | title=Furry Fin Flappers and Pelted Piscatorial Prizes Puebloan Cheiftan, November 1938 | publisher=Furbearingtrout.com | accessdate=May 1, 2014}}</ref> Foshay promoted the story so convincingly that it was picked up by the ''Salida Record'' newspaper.<ref name="ch">{{cite web | url=http://www.chieftain.com/news/region/upperark/2457868-120/fur-trout-salida-bearing | title=Fur-bearing trout | publisher=Chieftain.com | date=April 11, 2014 | accessdate=May 1, 2014 | author=Harmon, Tracy}}</ref> According to its Foshay, the trout grew fur due to the cold temperatures of the [[Arkansas River]] and shed the fur as the water temperatures warmed in the summer.<ref name=ch /> In November 1938, a story in the ''Puebloan Cheiftan'' recounted the hairy trout history and stated that "[o]ld-timers living along the Arkansas River near Salida have told tales for many years of the fur-bearing trout indigenous to the waters of the Arkansas near there."<ref name=fbt1 /> In 2014, ''[[Mysteries at the Museum]]'' visited the Salida Museum and {{As of|2014|05||lc=y}} is expected to be part of a segment in late 2014.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.themountainmail.com/free_content/article_15bacc52-844d-11e3-9f0e-001a4bcf6878.html | title=Film crew visits Salida Museum | publisher=The Mountain Mail | date=January 23, 2014 | accessdate=May 1, 2014 | author=Shovald, Arlene}}</ref>
A [[tall tale]] was recounted by S.E. Schlosser, it states that hairy trout were the result of two bottles or four jugs of spilled hair tonic. To catch hairy trout, fisherman would act as barbers and lure fish from the waters with the offer of a free trim or shave.<ref name="moh" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://americanfolklore.net/folklore/2010/08/furbearing_trout.html|title=Fur-Bearing Trout: From Tall tales at Americanfolklore.net|publisher=American Folklore|accessdate=May 1, 2014}}</ref> An intentionally fantastical story in Maine and claimed hairy trout were under [[catch and release]] policy that was enforced by wardens' carrying [[Brannock Device]]s. If a fish was caught, the warden would measure it against the fisher's foot. If the fish's length matched the fisher's foot size, the fish could be eaten and the pelt made into furry [[slippers]].<ref name=odd>{{cite web | url=http://www.furbearingtrout.com/mythick.html | title=There's P.R.O.O.F. in Mythick Mythick county's Preservation Restoration Of Oddities Forever | publisher=Furbearingtrout.com | accessdate=May 1, 2014}}</ref>
== Canada == The Canadian fur-bearing trout is another example of the furry trout hoax. According to the story, a trout with white fur was caught in [[Lake Superior]] off Gros Cap in [[Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario|Sault Ste. Marie]], [[Ontario]], [[Algoma District]], Canada, and its taxidermist was Ross C. Jobe of Sault Ste. Marie.<ref name=type /> The purchaser of the fish learned of the hoax after presenting it to the [[Royal Museum of Scotland]]. The white fur of a rabbit was described as being "ingeniously" attached to the fish.<ref name=type /> A fictional description of the Canadian "Hairy" Trout was published by Takeshi Yamada.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.furbearingtrout.com/hairytrout.html | title=The Canadian "Hairy" Trout Takeshi Yamada | publisher=Furbearingtrout.com | accessdate=1 May 2014}}</ref>
== See also == *[[Fearsome critters]] *[[Fish fur]]
== References == {{reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.furbearingtrout.com The Fur-Bearing Trout, Myth or Marvel]
{{American tall tales}}

revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=January 2011}} The '''Kathmandu International Mountain Film Festival (KIMFF)''' has been held in [[Kathmandu]] since 2000. Starting out as a biennial festival, KIMFF turned annual and competitive in 2007. KIMFF typically takes places around 11 December to coincide with the [[Mountain Day|International Mountain Day]].
==Modes== KIMFF uses [[Movie theater|cinema]]s, other [[visual arts|visual art forms]], workshops and discussion forums to inform and educate as wide and as large a variety of audience on particular issues within the duration of the festival. After the completion of festival in Kathmandu, a special package of films is taken to various locations within Nepal as a part of ''Travelling KIMFF''. Extreme sports, adventure, religion, or distinct cultural practices, human beings relate with mountains in a myriad of ways. In a world whose character and landscapes are rapidly changing, our relationship with mountains is only getting broader, subtler, and more intricate. The growing diversity and complexity of this relationship is what Kathmandu International Mountain Film Festival (KIMFF) seeks to explore.
KIMFF, the only festival of its kind east of Suez, brings to Kathmandu Valley some of the most recent and exciting films about mountains, mountain environment, mountain cultures and communities from various corners of the world. KIMFF screens films produced during the last three years and features discussion forums, on-demand screenings, as well as exhibitions of books and photography celebrating mountains. The festival is organized with the conviction that human experiences in the world’s highlands, especially those in the developing countries, is worth documenting and sharing. KIMFF hopes not only to encourage a deeper understanding of the social and cultural realities of those regions but also to create a sense that the significance of those regions is often far-flung. Organized by Himal Association, KIMFF started as a non-competitive, biennial festival in 2000. A wide selection of films – alpine documentation, archival footage, adventure cinema, experimental shorts, commentaries, anthropological narratives, feature films, etc. – have been screened in the previous four festivals. These movies have dealt with issues regarding cultural practices, lifestyles, conflict, wildlife, mountain-climbing, environment, globalization, and gender, among many others.
Over the years, the festival has attracted not only filmmakers, film enthusiasts, and critics, but also scholars, journalists, activists, and mountaineers. It is the interest of this creative and intellectual community that has sustained KIMFF and placed Kathmandu Valley on the map of international film festivals. The impetus for the festival has always been the trust of this community in the capability of the audio-visual medium in creating social and economic transformations.
==International== KIMFF is also one of the member of [[Mountain film|International Alliance for Mountain Film]] (IAMF)<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.mountainfilmalliance.org/|title= International Alliance for Mountain Film}}</ref> among others like [[Banff Mountain Film Festival]], [[Trento|Trento Film Festival]], [[Autrans]] and others.
==See also== * [[Mountain film]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.kimff.org Kathmandu International Mountain Film Festival (KIMFF)]
[[Category:Film festivals in Nepal]] [[Category:Cinema of Nepal]] [[Category:Mountaineering festivals]] [[Category:Winter events in Nepal]]
{{film-festival-stub}}

{{Infobox recurring event | name = Lakme Fashion Week | image = Sridevi still3 (cropped2).jpg | caption = [[Sridevi]] at the Lakme Fashion Week in 2010 | sponsor = IMG Reliance | date = | begins = | ends = | frequency = Bi-Annual in April and August | location = [[Mumbai]], India | years_active = | first = 1999 | last = | website = }} '''Lakme Fashion Week''' is a bi-annual fashion event that takes place in [[Mumbai]]. Its ''Summer-Resort'' show takes place in April while the ''Winter-Festive'' show takes place in August.<ref name=iejuly11>{{cite news|title=ANOTHER FASHION WEEK ?|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/another-fashion-week/821039/|accessdate=1 April 2012|newspaper=''[[The Indian Express]]''|date=23 July 2011}}</ref>
==Activities== It is considered a premier fashion event in India.<ref name=reuters08>{{cite news|title=Mumbai all set for Lakme Fashion Week|url=http://in.reuters.com/article/2008/03/19/idINIndia-32577020080319|accessdate=1 April 2012|newspaper=''[[Reuters]]''|date=19 March 2008}}</ref> It is run by ''IMG Reliance'' and the title sponsor is [[Lakmé Cosmetics|Lakme]].<ref name=toi02>{{cite news|title=Fashion business poised for dramatic growth: FDCI|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/Fashion-business-poised-for-dramatic-growth-FDCI/articleshow/17896739.cms|accessdate=1 April 2012|newspaper=''[[Times of India]]''|date=2 August 2002}}</ref>
The event first took place in 1999 and international models such as [[Naomi Campbell]] as well as Indian film stars such as [[Deepika Padukone]], [[Malaika Arora Khan]], and [[Arjun Rampal]] have participated in it. International labels that have taken part in LFW include [[Louis Vuitton]], [[Dolce & Gabbana]], and [[Roberto Cavalli]]. Among Indian designers, [[Manish Malhotra]], [[Rohit Bal]], [[Tarun Tahiliani]], and [[Ritu Beri]] have taken part in the event.<ref>{{cite news|title=LFW 2013 announced|url=http://www.vogue.in/content/lakme-fashion-week-2013-dates-announced|accessdate=15 October 2012}}</ref><ref name=ieaugust11>{{cite news|title=Fashion's Milestones|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/fashions-milestones/832225/0|accessdate=1 April 2012|newspaper=''[[The Indian Express]]''|date=16 August 2011}}</ref> The event has been responsible for launching the careers of designers such as [[Sabyasachi Mukherjee]].<ref name=tt05>{{cite news|title=New star rises from east|url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1050424/asp/nation/story_4654867.asp|accessdate=1 April 2012|newspaper=''[[The Telegraph (Calcutta)|The Telegraph]]''|date=24 April 2005}}</ref> [[Kareena Kapoor]], [[Jacqueline Fernandez]], [[Priyanka Chopra]], [[Deepika Padukone]] and [[Lisa Haydon]] have been some of the major show-stoppers till date.
==See also== * [[Fashion in India]] * [[India Fashion Week]] * [[India Runway Week]]
==References== {{reflist|2}}
==External links== {{commonscategory}} * [http://www.apnnews.com/2015/07/14/nations-most-coveted-model-auditions-at-lakme-fashion-week-is-back/ Mumbai Auditions] * [http://lakmefashionweek.co.in/ Lakme Fashion Week, website] * [http://hoture.com/category/lakmefashionweek-2013-fc/ Lakme Fashion Week 2013 videos]
[[Category:Annual events in India]] [[Category:Fashion events in India]] [[Category:Culture of Mumbai]] [[Category:Recurring events established in 1999]] [[Category:1999 establishments in India]]

page.title: Les Femmes Underground International Film Festival

revision.text:
{{Infobox film festival|name=Les Femmes Underground International Film Festival|logo=|image=|image_size=|caption=|number=|location=[[Los Angeles]], [[California]], U.S.
[[San Diego]], [[California]], U.S.
[[Arizona]], [[Phoenix, Arizona|Phoenix]], U.S.|founded=2015|language=[[English language|English]]|website={{url|https://www.lesfemmesinternational.org}}}}The '''Les Femmes Underground International Film Festival''' is an annual women's film festival held in the [[United States]] which previews new films of multiple genres, including documentaries, from over 30 different countries. Founded in 2015, the traveling festival is held annually (usually in September) at various venues in the [[Southwestern United States]]. It is based in [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles, CA]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.lesfemmesinternational.org/about|title=les-femmes-int|website=les-femmes-int|language=en|access-date=2018-06-20}} == History == The Les Femmes Underground International Film Festival originated in September 2016 at [[Beyond Baroque Literary Arts Center]] in [[Venice, Los Angeles|Venice, CA]]. It was founded the previous year, after filmmaker Edda Manriquez attended a [[Geena Davis Institute on Gender in Media]] seminar at [[CalArts]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.filminquiry.com/interview-edda-manriquez-les-femmes-undergound-international-film-festival/|title=Interview With Edda Manriquez, Director Of The Les Femmes Undergound International Film Festival {{!}} Film Inquiry|website=www.filminquiry.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-20}} In 2017, the festival was held at Digital Gym Cinema in [[San Diego|San Diego, CA]],{{Cite web|url=https://www.dreadcentral.com/news/247944/2nd-annual-les-femmes-underground-international-film-fest-casts-its-spell-on-san-diego/|title=2nd Annual Les Femmes Underground International Film Fest Casts its Spell on San Diego - Dread Central|website=www.dreadcentral.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-20}}{{Cite news|url=http://thedailyaztec.com/83895/artsandculture/les-femmes-international-film-festival-comes-to-san-diego/|title=Les Femmes International Film Festival comes to San Diego|last=Dyer|first=Danny|work=The Daily Aztec|access-date=2018-06-20|language=en-US}} and in 2018, it is set to be held at Phoenix Center for the Arts in [[Phoenix, Arizona|Phoenix, AZ]]. Manriquez and her partner created the festival with the intent of bringing [[Feminism|feminist]] diversity to media, breaking gender-based stereotypes, and empowering young female filmmakers to generate such work.{{Cite news|url=http://www.kpbs.org/news/2017/sep/01/les-femmes-underground-international-film-festival/|title=Les Femmes Underground International Film Festival|last=Accomando|first=Beth|work=KPBS Public Media|access-date=2018-06-20|language=en}}{{Cite web|url=https://argonautnews.com/women-outside-the-frame/|title=Women Outside the Frame {{!}} The Argonaut Newsweekly|website=argonautnews.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-20}}{{Citation|last=KPBS News|title=Friday, September 1, 2017 - Evening Edition|date=2017-09-01|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RMVQ3ZIgPag|access-date=2018-06-20}} They also sought to bridge cultural and socioeconomic restrictions and became a traveling film festival{{Cite news|url=http://blog.calarts.edu/2016/09/02/calartians-screen-films-at-1st-les-femmes-underground-international-film-festival/|title=CalArtians Screen Films at 1st Les Femmes Underground International Film Festival|last=|first=|date=|work=CalArts|access-date=2018-06-20|language=en-US}} with the intent of alleviating traveling costs for emerging feminist filmmakers while giving them a platform and celebrating their accomplishments.{{Cite news|url=https://thecreativeoutsiders.com/2016/04/29/10-film-festivals-that-support-women-filmmakers/|title=10 Film Festivals That Support Women Filmmakers|date=2016-04-29|access-date=2018-06-20|language=en-US}} The Les Femmes Underground International Film Festival is a registered [[Nonprofit organization|non-profit]] [[501(c)(3) organization]].{{Cite web|url=https://apps.irs.gov/app/eos/displayAll.do?dispatchMethod=displayAllInfo&Id=4716087&ein=811775059&zipCode=&country=US&deductibility=all&dispatchMethod=searchAll&isDescending=false&city=&ein1=&postDateFrom=&exemptTypeCode=al&submitName=Search&sortColumn=orgName&totalResults=1&names=Les+Femmes+Underground+International+Film+Festival&resultsPerPage=25&indexOfFirstRow=0&postDateTo=&searchChoice=&state=All+States|title=Details about Les Femmes Underground International Film Festival|last=|first=|date=|website=IRS.gov|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-06-20}} The festival specializes in [[Fourth-wave feminism|fourth-wave feminist]] film sub-genres, including [[Documentary film|documentary]], [[Experimental film|experimental]], [[Narrative film|narrative]], [[Horror film|horror]], [[Animation film|animation]], and [[Virtual reality|VR]]. They focus on "subversive, unique, and innovative" topics such as [[Human female sexuality|female sexuality]], [[Western esotericism|esotericism]], [[witchcraft]], and [[occult]] ideology in support of [[gender equality]], women's independence, and [[women's empowerment]].{{Cite news|url=http://msinthebiz.com/2016/09/21/film-fest-females-spotlight-les-femmes-underground/|title=Film Fest Females: Spotlight on 'Les Femmes Underground’ - Ms. In The Biz|date=2016-09-21|work=Ms. In The Biz|access-date=2018-06-20|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.kpbs.org/events/2017/sep/02/les-femmes-underground-internationa/?et=81103|title=Les Femmes Underground International Film Festival 2017|website=KPBS Public Media|language=en|access-date=2018-06-20}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.cinemawithoutborders.com/les-femmes-underground-international-film-festival/|title=Les Femmes Underground International film festival - Cinema Without Borders|date=2017-08-21|work=Cinema Without Borders|access-date=2018-06-20|language=en-US}} Manriquez is cited as calling the festival "a cinematic adventure that destroys the meaning of mundane through its unique programming via the underground world of [[Intersectional feminism|feminist intersectional]] art, music, and celluloid fantasies."{{Cite news|url=http://sdvoyager.com/interview/meet-edda-manriquez-les-femmes-underground-international-film-festival-north-park/|title=Meet Edda Manriquez of Les Femmes Underground International Film Festival - SDVoyager - San Diego|work=SDVoyager - San Diego|access-date=2018-06-20|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://festivalreviews.org/2017/02/17/interview-with-festival-director-edda-manriquez-les-femmes-underground-film-festival/|title=Interview with Festival Director Edda Manriquez (Les Femmes Underground Film Festival)|date=2017-02-17|work=Festival Reviews|access-date=2018-06-20|language=en-US}} The festival also provides outreach events, including Books for Babes, a literacy initiative which aims to bring feminist children's books to underrepresented communities, including [[Teenage pregnancy|teenage mothers]], [[Women's shelter|women's shelters]], [[Poverty in the United States|low-income areas]], and [[Single parent|single parent households]], in the United States. They also provide traveling workshops in health and wellness, women's empowerment, career resources, and financial assistance to women and female-identifying artists who are attempting to acquire film distribution and further their careers. They focus specifically on the [[Boyle Heights, Los Angeles|Boyle Heights]] and [[San Fernando Valley]] areas in [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles, CA]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.thebooksforbabes.org/about_us|title=Books for Babes {{!}} About|last=|first=|date=|website=booksforbabes|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-06-20}} The Les Femmes Underground International Film Festival hosts regular panels and events, including a screening of the documentary ''[[Fattitude]]'' at [[Echo Park Film Center]], which explored the topic "Deconstructing the Female Body in Media" during [[Women's History Month]] in 2018.{{Cite web|url=http://www.fattitudethemovie.com/local-screenings/2018/3/10/la-femmes-international-echo-park-film|title=La Femmes International {{!}} Echo Park Film|last=|first=|date=|website=Fattitude|language=en-US|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-06-20}} Panel alumni guests for the ''[[Fattitude]]'' screening and panel include writer and actress Celia Finkelstein, author and sociology professor Abigail C. Saguy, activist and public speaker Pia Schiavo-Campo, and author and speaker Ragen Chastain.{{Cite web|url=https://www.lesfemmesinternational.org/fattitude-encore|title=les-femmes-int {{!}} Fattitude Encore|website=les-femmes-int|language=en|access-date=2018-07-03}} == Awards == Jury awards are given for Experimental Film, Narrative Film, Documentary Film, and Animated Film. == Past winners == === 2016 Jury Awards === {| class="wikitable sortable" !Award !Film !Director |- | rowspan="5" |'''Jury Award''' |''Hoop Dreams'' |Sam Gurry |- |''First of the Free Girls'' |Alexandra Velasco & Alexander Kahan |- |''VAL-EN-TINA'' |Araeia Robinson |- |''The River'' |Ya-Ting Hsu & Geoffrey Hughes |- |''Rougarou'' |Catherine Taylor |} === 2017 Jury Awards === {| class="wikitable" !Award !Film !Director |- | rowspan="7" |'''Jury Award''' |''Troll: A Southern Tale'' |Marinah Janello |- |''Tomato'' |Caitlin Craggs |- |''Quetzal'' |Irene Marco |- |''Sacrifice'' |Elena Passani & Jade Touron |- |''Sherry'' |Eliane Lima |- |''Brew Master'' |Kelly Jean Karam |- |''Naked in the Dog Park'' |Tiffany Rhodes |} {{Cite web|url=https://www.lesfemmesinternational.org/2016-jury-official|title=Les Femmes Int {{!}} Past Winners|last=|first=|date=|website=Les Femmes Int|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-06-20}} == References == == External links == * {{official|http://www.lesfemmesinternational.org}} [[Category:Recurring events established in 2015]] [[Category:Film festivals in California]] [[Category:Annual events in California]] [[Category:Film festivals established in 2015]] [[Category:Women's film festivals]] [[Category:Feminist filmmakers]] [[Category:Women's film organizations]]

{|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image | Ship image = Wallenius Wilhelmsen - MV Tampa.JPG | Ship caption = ''MV Tampa'' at [[Papeete]], [[French Polynesia]] }} {{Infobox ship career | Ship flag = | Ship name =*'''Tampa'' *''Barber Tampa'' | Ship owner = [[Wilh. Wilhelmsen|Wilhelmsen Lines Shipowning]] | Ship operator = | Ship registry = {{NOR}} | Ship route = | Ship builder =*[[Hyundai Heavy Industries]] *[[Ulsan]], South Korea | Ship original cost = | Ship yard number = 248 | Ship way number = | Ship laid down = | Ship launched = | Ship completed = 1984 | Ship christened = | Ship acquired = | Ship maiden voyage = | Ship in service = | Ship out of service = | Ship identification =*[[Call sign]]: LMWO3 *{{IMO Number|8204951}} *[[Maritime Mobile Service Identity|MMSI no.:]] 257497000 | Ship fate = | Ship status = | Ship notes =<ref>{{csr|register=SD|id=166504|shipname=Tampa|accessdate=19 May 2013}}</ref> }} {{Infobox ship characteristics | Hide header = | Header caption = | Ship class = | Ship tonnage =*{{DWT|39,900}} *{{GT|66,532}} | Ship displacement = | Ship length = {{convert|262.3|m|abbr=on}} | Ship beam = {{convert|32.26|m|abbr=on}} | Ship height = | Ship draught = {{convert|9.78|m|abbr=on}} | Ship depth = | Ship decks = 12 | Ship deck clearance = | Ship ramps = | Ship ice class = | Ship sail plan = | Ship power = | Ship propulsion = | Ship speed = {{convert|21|kn}} | Ship capacity = | Ship crew = 25 | Ship notes =<ref>{{cite web | author= | title=MV ''Tampa'' | url=http://www.wilhelmsen.com/services/shipping/fleet/Pages/MVTampa.aspx | publisher=Wilh. Wilhelmsen | date=2010 | accessdate=4 June 2010 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100204085357/http://www.wilhelmsen.com/services/shipping/fleet/Pages/MVTampa.aspx | archivedate=4 February 2010 | df=dmy-all }}</ref> }} |}
'''MV ''Tampa''''' is a [[roll-on/roll-off]] [[container ship]] completed in 1984 by [[Hyundai Heavy Industries|Hyundai Heavy Industries Co., Ltd.]] in South Korea for the Norway-based firm, [[Wilh. Wilhelmsen|Wilhelmsen Lines Shipowning]].
==Tampa affair== {{main|Tampa affair}} [[File:ABC Tampa.ogv|right|thumb|[[Australian Broadcasting Corporation|ABC]] news report of the ''Tampa affair'' and its political context, October 2001.]] In August 2001, under Captain [[Arne Rinnan]], a diplomatic dispute brewed between Australia, [[Norway]], and [[Indonesia]] after ''Tampa'' rescued 438 Afghans from a distressed fishing vessel in international waters. The Afghans wanted passage to nearby [[Christmas Island]]. The [[Howard Government|Australian government]] sought to prevent this by refusing ''Tampa'' entry into Australian waters, insisting on their disembarkment elsewhere, and deploying the [[Australian Special Air Service Regiment|Special Air Service Regiment]] to board the ship. At the time of the incident, ''Tampa'' carried cargo worth {{A$|20 million}}, and 27 crew.
The crew of ''Tampa'' received the [[Nansen Refugee Award]] for 2002 from the [[United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees]] (UNHCR) for their efforts to follow international principles of saving people in distress at sea.
==Cocaine smuggling bust== In October 2006, MV ''Tampa'' was one of two Wilhelmsen ships involved in a [[cocaine]]-smuggling operation intercepted by the [[New Zealand Customs Service]] and the [[Australian Federal Police]]. Twenty-seven kilograms of cocaine was allegedly attached to the side of the two cargo ships bound for Australia in purpose-built metal pods, although New Zealand authorities stated they did not believe the ship's crew or owners were involved.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Crewdson |first=Patrick |url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/national/tampa-one-of-two-ships-named-in-cocaine-bust/2006/10/26/1161749257097.html |title=''Tampa'' one of two ships named in cocaine bust |work=The Age |date=27 October 2006}}</ref>
== MythBusters test model== In the 2006 episode [[List of MythBusters episodes#Season 4: 2006|"Whirlpool/Snowplow"]] of the TV show ''[[MythBusters]]'', a 1:550 scale model of MV ''Tampa'' was assembled, weighted with lead shot to simulate a full load of cargo, and used as a scale scientific [[test bed]] vehicle for determining whether ocean [[whirlpool]]s are capable of sinking a large container ship.
==See also== * [[MV Taiko|MV ''Taiko'']] *[[Ruddock v Vadarlis]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==Further reading== * [http://www.austlii.edu.au/au/cases/cth/federal_ct/2001/1297.html Decision of Justice North, Federal Court of Australia] 11 September 2001 * [http://www.austlii.edu.au/au/cases/cth/federal_ct/2001/1329.html Decision of Full Court] overturning decision of Justice North, 18 September 2001 *[[David Marr (journalist)|David Marr]] & [[Marian Wilkinson]] ''[[Dark Victory (book)|Dark Victory]]''. {{ISBN|1-74114-447-7}} *{{cite book|first=Ian|last=McPhedran|author-link=Ian McPhedran|title=The Amazing SAS|isbn=0-7322-7981-X|publisher=HarperCollins|date=2005}} *[https://web.archive.org/web/20060920161759/http://blogs.news.com.au/news/news/index.php/news/comments/in_the_tampa_confusion_we_lost_our_moral_bearings/ News.com.au]: Reflections by Julian Burnside on Tampa with public comments published to coincide with 5-year anniversary of the event *[[Daniel Ross (Australian philosopher and filmmaker)|Daniel Ross]], ''Violent Democracy'', ch. 5.
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20050624075827/http://www.nauruwire.org/nauru.htm NauruWire, an Australia based site] Update on status of detainees. Accessed 25 June 2005.
{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2014}}
